revisions:
[{'created': '2013-01-03 13:47:15.000000000', 'message': "Merge LibvirtOpenVswitchVirtualPortDriver into LibvirtOpenVswitchDriver

The LibvirtOpenVswitchVirtualPortDriver VIF driver and the
LibvirtOpenVswitchDriver VIF driver both support OpenVswitch
based guest configs. The only difference is that the former
uses libvirt's modern <network type='bridge'> with vport
profile specified, while the latter uses <network type='ethernet'>
and does all openvswitch setup itself. The reason for the latter
is to support running against libvirt versions older than 0.9.11

Rather than require the host admin to figure this out themselves,
merge the two classes together and automatically choose the right
impl based on the libvirt version we're running against

Change-Id: I1fb357ef9de35168d936e3c6dcbf0d4efc3692f6
Signed-off-by: Daniel P. Berrange <berrange@redhat.com>
"}, {'created': '2013-01-03 15:01:38.000000000', 'message': "Merge LibvirtOpenVswitchVirtualPortDriver into LibvirtOpenVswitchDriver

The LibvirtOpenVswitchVirtualPortDriver VIF driver and the
LibvirtOpenVswitchDriver VIF driver both support OpenVswitch
based guest configs. The only difference is that the former
uses libvirt's modern <network type='bridge'> with vport
profile specified, while the latter uses <network type='ethernet'>
and does all openvswitch setup itself. The reason for the latter
is to support running against libvirt versions older than 0.9.11

Rather than require the host admin to figure this out themselves,
merge the two classes together and automatically choose the right
impl based on the libvirt version we're running against

Change-Id: I1fb357ef9de35168d936e3c6dcbf0d4efc3692f6
Signed-off-by: Daniel P. Berrange <berrange@redhat.com>
"}, {'created': '2013-01-07 18:38:20.000000000', 'message': "Merge LibvirtOpenVswitchVirtualPortDriver into LibvirtOpenVswitchDriver

The LibvirtOpenVswitchVirtualPortDriver VIF driver and the
LibvirtOpenVswitchDriver VIF driver both support OpenVswitch
based guest configs. The only difference is that the former
uses libvirt's modern <network type='bridge'> with vport
profile specified, while the latter uses <network type='ethernet'>
and does all openvswitch setup itself. The reason for the latter
is to support running against libvirt versions older than 0.9.11

Rather than require the host admin to figure this out themselves,
merge the two classes together and automatically choose the right
impl based on the libvirt version we're running against

The LibvirtOpenVswitchVirtualPortDriver class is kept around as
a trivial subclass of LibvirtOpenVswitchDriver for backwards
compatibility. It will be removed in the Hxxx release.

Blueprint: libvirt-vif-driver
Change-Id: I1fb357ef9de35168d936e3c6dcbf0d4efc3692f6
Signed-off-by: Daniel P. Berrange <berrange@redhat.com>
"}]
commit_message:
Merge LibvirtOpenVswitchVirtualPortDriver into LibvirtOpenVswitchDriver

The LibvirtOpenVswitchVirtualPortDriver VIF driver and the
LibvirtOpenVswitchDriver VIF driver both support OpenVswitch
based guest configs. The only difference is that the former
uses libvirt's modern <network type='bridge'> with vport
profile specified, while the latter uses <network type='ethernet'>
and does all openvswitch setup itself. The reason for the latter
is to support running against libvirt versions older than 0.9.11

Rather than require the host admin to figure this out themselves,
merge the two classes together and automatically choose the right
impl based on the libvirt version we're running against

The LibvirtOpenVswitchVirtualPortDriver class is kept around as
a trivial subclass of LibvirtOpenVswitchDriver for backwards
compatibility. It will be removed in the Hxxx release.

Blueprint: libvirt-vif-driver
Change-Id: I1fb357ef9de35168d936e3c6dcbf0d4efc3692f6
Signed-off-by: Daniel P. Berrange <berrange@redhat.com>

[{'created': '2012-12-28 10:38:10.000000000', 'message': 'Close kombu.connection.BrokerConnection correctly

Make kombu.connection.BrokerConnection use release() to close the connection.
It has no such attribute as close(), since AttributeError is in
connection_errors, the fault was previous concealed by the following catch
statement.

Change-Id: I9f7da2c64f9d408aa2a9ddf723ea83291887cff6
'}]
commit_message:
Close kombu.connection.BrokerConnection correctly

Make kombu.connection.BrokerConnection use release() to close the connection.
It has no such attribute as close(), since AttributeError is in
connection_errors, the fault was previous concealed by the following catch
statement.

Change-Id: I9f7da2c64f9d408aa2a9ddf723ea83291887cff6

commit_message:
Add common base weigher/weigher handler for filter scheduler

Filter scheduler is being used for more than one core projects (Nova
and Cinder as of writing), the implementation shared a lot of common
code. This patch is to move base weigher (weighing function), weigher
handler for filter scheduler into oslo to reduce possible porting.

implement bp: common-weights

Change-Id: I2d1b37438663b53e035cc262875a283e5e2ee970

messages: [{'account_id': 4325, 'date': '2012-12-13 11:28:00.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2012-12-13 12:30:26.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Works for me Build successful - http://logs.openstack.org/18030/2/check/gate-tempest-merge/1246 : SUCCESS - http://logs.openstack.org/18030/2/check/gate-tempest-pep8/1200 : SUCCESS - http://logs.openstack.org/18030/2/check/gate-tempest-devstack-vm/22153 : SUCCESS '}, {'account_id': 5196, 'date': '2012-12-13 16:18:12.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: I would prefer that you didn't merge this (8 inline comments) So I started reviewing you code before I looked at the bug. Based on your results you posted of just manually running xml_to_json, this is unnecessary complex. I left my comments on the code in anyway. Look at some of the other xml to dict conversions that error is pretty common with xml_to_json(). For example, take a look at how I handled metadata in volumes_extension_client.py. It's not exactly the same but a similar situation. In my opinion it's much easier to follow that than what you submitted here."}, {'account_id': 4325, 'date': '2013-01-02 13:24:28.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: (8 inline comments) volumes_extensions_client:_parse_volume? I can see that that code deals with bit easier problem to solve, therefore it is less complex. I can also see that it is just ignoring the namespace, which is certainly not a good thing to do.'}, {'account_id': 5196, 'date': '2013-01-02 19:24:57.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: (6 inline comments) You're right about the namespace checking. Could you file a bug for that. It's definitely something that we'll want to fix. I think the namespace is ignored for the most part in most of the existing XML stuff. What I was trying to say was that your code here was a little hard to follow at first glance, you could look at that or a similar existing method to make this easier to follow. My suggestion was basically to use a loop like in _parse_volume() and then call _addresses_xml_to_json() when needed. But, I think if you clean up the logic of _server_xml_to_json() to make it a bit easier to follow that would work too."}, {'account_id': 4325, 'date': '2013-01-03 14:41:57.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-01-03 15:55:24.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: Doesn't seem to work Build failed - commit_message:
Add test for resize server in ComputeAPITestCase.

Add test_resize_quota_exceeds_fails for TooManyInstances,
and fixes a typo in test_resize_deleted_flavor_fails.

Change-Id: Iec21deac3701df4ea1b6eb7e9d3da9c31924e589

commit_message:
Remove the global DATA

In test cases for trusted filter, a global variable is used
to fake the OAT HTTP request.

Remove this global variable, to make code cleaner.

Change-Id: Id75077575917e501d51f83d3c4b1c4250fbc84d0
Signed-off-by: Yunhong, Jiang <yunhong.jiang@intel.com>

commit_message:
Make WebOb version specification more flexible

Change the WebOb version to >=1.0.8 as an temporary
measure to allow the actual version update to 1.2.3
to roll out across the projects one at a time without
breaking the integration tests.

Change-Id: I9969b02a6896f7b952301e40e96f0ef6df8f34c0
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug.hellmann@dreamhost.com>

[{'created': '2013-01-02 17:48:03.000000000', 'message': 'Add compute build/resize errors to instance faults

Save exception during build and resize operations in instance faults.
This will making it easier to see the individual compute errors that
occurred when an operation got re-scheduled.

Change-Id: I4224b9638aa9b7572fc0ee1ef6fa3e6654b84805

commit_message:
Add compute build/resize errors to instance faults

Save exception during build and resize operations in instance faults.
This will making it easier to see the individual compute errors that
occurred when an operation got re-scheduled.

Change-Id: I4224b9638aa9b7572fc0ee1ef6fa3e6654b84805

commit_message:

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-01-04 17:34:09.000000000', 'message': 'heat engine : map DBInstance DBSecurityGroups parameter correctly

The DBInstance nested stack template defines a DBSecurityGroups list parameter,
which should be "CommaDelimitedList" type, curently it's a "List" type which
breaks when the template is parsed.  To make this work we also have to mangle
the property (passed in the top level template) format to match the parameter
format, because in AWS Lists are not represented in the same way for Properties and
Parameters (sigh..)

fixes bug 1096099

Change-Id: Ie078d61847d89ea9dcd55f798b808e595c2d2e12
Signed-off-by: Steven Hardy <shardy@redhat.com>

commit_message:
heat engine : map DBInstance DBSecurityGroups parameter correctly

The DBInstance nested stack template defines a DBSecurityGroups list parameter,
which should be "CommaDelimitedList" type, curently it's a "List" type which
breaks when the template is parsed.  To make this work we also have to mangle
the property (passed in the top level template) format to match the parameter
format, because in AWS Lists are not represented in the same way for Properties and
Parameters (sigh..)

fixes bug 1096099

Change-Id: Ie078d61847d89ea9dcd55f798b808e595c2d2e12
Signed-off-by: Steven Hardy <shardy@redhat.com>

"}]
commit_message:
Handle compute node records with no timestamp.

Commit 94560ab57d9fc23673f42017e6f2a78cb2b66b7a added a fast-path
to avoid work when baremetal compute nodes haven't changed, but if
the compute message has None for its updated-at timestamp (which
can happen during startup) the comparison crashes.

Change-Id: Ib8add431d975eee133deefea62eb53479a97396e

Sorry for late response.  I was on a nice long holiday break.

The doc here looks generally fine.  Its level of detail is sufficient.

Regarding "Due to a limitation in the Linux kernel, you cannot modify a
partition table of a disk that has partition currently mounted (you can for
LVM, but not for "raw disks");", that limitation has been addressed in kernels 3.6 and greater [1].  I expect that in the future cloud-init will be able to handle this without a initramfs piece.

[1] http://lwn.net/Articles/481141/'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2013-01-02 04:00:54.000000000', 'message': 'Describe image customizations to support resize.

Add a section to describe how images should be customized to support
OpenStack.

commit_message:
Describe image customizations to support resize.

Add a section to describe how images should be customized to support
OpenStack.

In particular, it adds a section that describes how to support
resizing partitions on boot.

Patchset has minor edits (wilil for will).

Change-Id: I890f6cce5eeb11852f3e9dbb87e16afba1862d1a

Add a latex command to our sphinx builders.

The libra project added this locally and use it for some docs they make. It
seemed like something we could add what we provide globally.

'}, {'created': '2013-01-07 13:56:06.000000000', 'message': 'Eliminate sleep in the lockutils test case (across processes)

commit_message:
Eliminate sleep in the lockutils test case (across processes)

Fork many processes and try to lock the same set of files
using flock without blocking and make sure we wait for all the processes
to finish as well.

Fixes LP #1068316

Change-Id: I09964b2c5af63f31b5ddee1f18eaf646f8d8ba58

commit_message:
Provide a PXE NodeDriver for the Baremetal driver

This patch implements a PXE NodeDriver class within the Baremetal
provisioning framework, which provides a means for deploying machine
images using TFTP and PXE.

This patch relies on functionality provided by the nova-baremetal-deploy-helper
utility, implemented in review 15830.

blueprint general-bare-metal-provisioning-framework.

Change-Id: I8d849601186e3dc13f10382857ff2bbc1ff1026d

The cfg changes are probably the most significant - can you make that a separate patch and I'll help out?"}, {'account_id': 1247, 'date': '2013-01-07 13:27:28.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

Ah, the set_defaults() stuff. We could keep that separate too, but easier is just to import newer cfg first and then import the other stuff

I've split up the commits here: https://github.com/markmc/quantum/branches/split-up-olso-sync

Just do:

  $> git fetch git://github.com/markmc/quantum.git split-up-olso-sync

then:

  $> git push gerrit FETCH_HEAD:refs/for/master

or:

  $> git checkout -b oslo-sync FETCH_HEAD
  $> git review"}, {'account_id': 1653, 'date': '2013-01-07 13:27:28.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

commit_message:
Update latest OSLO files

Note due to a change in the cfg module all interfaces passing
sys.argv had to be updated to sys.argv[1:].

Pip requires has also been updated to include OSLO dependency modules.

commit_message:
Handle finish and revert resize notifications.

Fixes bug 1057571

Ensure that the modified instance type is reflected in the
metering data in a more timely fashion than would be allowed
by the default pollster frequency, or the cadance of the
compute.instance.exists notifications.

Change-Id: I34f01eebddfe9732d5bf69c331a0d8a63a8025ca

commit_message:
Fix T401 and T402 errors

Fix all the one line docstring errors in T401 and T402, now
we no longer ignore any of our own rules in hacking.py

Fix run_tests.sh to pick up the 'stress' directory, which tox
does for pep8. Additional fixes to the stress tests for T4* tests

Change-Id: Ie569a924e8eb355afbbd9b244f77dec34061b5cb

commit_message:
Fix test blocking issue and pin docutils version.

Mock out more methods of the nova conductor according to the latest nova
changes to fix the test blocking issue of the nova notifier.

Also pin docutils to 0.9.1 as a workaround to fix bug 1091333.

Change-Id: I1c4db4a5f5485dd563c2d48890be0334982e5a26

Looks like cirros uec disk image is an empty ext3 fs.
But it has a related kernel and initrd (initramfs) image.

Other images can contains partitions and/or lvm.

Do we need a partition argument for other images ?
Do we need a new per image configuration option for selecting partition?
I do not see how to select target partition or lvm lv.
Is it possible ? How does it handled ?

Can we expect the injection will do "mkdir -p" like operation in the future ?'}, {'account_id': 1812, 'date': '2013-01-06 18:08:23.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

For the test to be general and support various partitioned (with lvm etc.), or plain unpartitioned, libguestfs would
need to be available and libvirt_inject_partition set to -1.

To help you can set libvirt_inject_partition to match the image under test, the caveat there of course that that's a
global config option so needs to apply to all images under test. In future this could be improved by tagging the 
injection partition to use in glance for example.

As for nova doing `mkdir -p`, that's possible too.

In the meantime though the most general change and
to fix the immediate issue, would be this patch
that doesn't assume a particular file system layout."}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-01-07 01:56:11.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: No score

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-01-04 17:51:57.000000000', 'message': "fix file injection test to not assume /etc is present

File injection is currently failing as the /etc
directory is not present and the file injection
logic currently doesn't ensure a specified directory is present.
There is a pending change https://review.openstack.org/#/c/18900/
that changes operation so that a failure to inject user
specified files results in startup failure,
so adjust the test to inject to always present root dir.

Change-Id: I864272516e06ac0c2317b4470e263f5db41149f9
"}]
commit_message:
fix file injection test to not assume /etc is present

File injection is currently failing as the /etc
directory is not present and the file injection
logic currently doesn't ensure a specified directory is present.
There is a pending change https://review.openstack.org/#/c/18900/
that changes operation so that a failure to inject user
specified files results in startup failure,
so adjust the test to inject to always present root dir.

Change-Id: I864272516e06ac0c2317b4470e263f5db41149f9

If compute['updated_at'] is not yet initialized in the database,
scheduler/host_manager:update_from_compute_node will raise an exception
needlessly when it tries to update that compute host.
Instead, we should just update it.

Change-Id: I9d2a09477d95a4b85f56b5bb0b1d5d9bf18fc75e
"}]
commit_message:
Fix update_from_compute_node when updated_at=None

If compute['updated_at'] is not yet initialized in the database,
scheduler/host_manager:update_from_compute_node will raise an exception
needlessly when it tries to update that compute host.
Instead, we should just update it.

Change-Id: I9d2a09477d95a4b85f56b5bb0b1d5d9bf18fc75e

commit_message:
Enable the user to enforce validity of the gateway IP

Fixes bug 1096532

A new configuration variable is added to enable the user to indicate
if the gateway should be validated on the subnet. For backward
compatibility this is set as False by default.

Change-Id: Ieadd60a945d34703bfee7576aa3b2ff7da3143d4

Upgrading WebOb resolves a version conflict between OpenStack
and Pecan, the web framework used by the Ceilometer team for
version 2 of the ceilometer API.

commit_message:
Upgrade WebOb to 1.2.3

The version of WebOb being used in OpenStack was more than
1 year old. This change updates to the latest stable release.

Upgrading WebOb resolves a version conflict between OpenStack
and Pecan, the web framework used by the Ceilometer team for
version 2 of the ceilometer API.

Refer to http://docs.webob.org/en/latest/news.html
for the list of changes between 1.0.8 and 1.2.3.

Fixes Bug #1092227

Change-Id: Ie2c03678747a515c71fe1bd4b92400074817325f

'}, {'account_id': 447, 'date': '2013-01-03 23:53:13.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Looks good to me (core reviewer); Approved

Thanks for the info doug.  This makes sense, give that this was the commit message when we had to downgrade: 

commit 1ead125c9e28350175923390bb9058bba2aaf726
Author: Brian Waldon <bcwaldon@gmail.com>
Date:   Thu Sep 6 10:43:05 2012 -0700

    Lower webob dep from v1.2.0 to v1.0.8
    
    All other OpenStack projects expect webob v1.0.8 yet Quantum expects
    v1.2.0. This discrepancy causes problems for certain projects that
    can't actually support v1.2.0 yet. This patch aligns the required
    version with that which the other OpenStack projects expect.
    
    Change-Id: I21b4c6c79a0382f241131f22edbeba22388a688d"}, {'account_id': 447, 'date': '2013-01-03 23:53:13.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

We've actually been down the webob upgrade path before, and been forced to change it back.  doing a -1 until we can confirm that this is or is not an issue."}, {'account_id': 1653, 'date': '2013-01-03 23:53:13.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

'}, {'account_id': 2472, 'date': '2013-01-03 23:53:13.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

'}, {'account_id': 2472, 'date': '2013-01-03 23:53:13.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

My understanding was the previous attempt used a version that did not have some of the backwards-compatible changes included in 1.2.3, so it broke things. If we jump to 1.2.3, and skip the 1.1 releases, those issues don't seem to come up."}, {'account_id': 2592, 'date': '2013-01-03 23:53:13.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

I think this is something that has be coordinated with all the projects and packagers.  (Personally: I'd like to see us move to a newer version)."}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-01-03 23:53:13.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Verified

The version of WebOb being used in OpenStack was more than
1 year old. This change updates to the latest stable release.

Upgrading WebOb resolves a version conflict between OpenStack
and Pecan, the web framework used by the Ceilometer team for
version 2 of the ceilometer API.

Refer to http://docs.webob.org/en/latest/news.html

commit_message:
Upgrade WebOb to 1.2.3

The version of WebOb being used in OpenStack was more than
1 year old. This change updates to the latest stable release.

Upgrading WebOb resolves a version conflict between OpenStack
and Pecan, the web framework used by the Ceilometer team for
version 2 of the ceilometer API.

Refer to http://docs.webob.org/en/latest/news.html
for the list of changes between 1.0.8 and 1.2.3.

Fixes Bug #1092227

Change-Id: I07707607ae2067a567e11c347cddda9c7e6bcef7

commit_message:
Handle the two new snapshot statuses in EC2 API.

Change I256c5d21a1d23b87d2060cca99eb9839c5b89161 added two new
snapshot statuses. These need to be handled by the EC2 API as well.

Progresses blueprint snapshot-task-states

Change-Id: Ia45cb1e4e15e278e8dcd8f58ed139dd8bcddea45

This review allows periodic tasks to be enabled or disabled in the
decorator, as well as by specifying an interval which is negative.

The spacing between runs of a periodic task is now specified in
seconds, with zero meaning the default spacing which is currently 60
seconds.

I also remove the periodic_interval flag to services, as the interval

flag because I cannot see a use case for that. It is needed for unit
testing however.

commit_message:
Refactor periodic tasks.

This review allows periodic tasks to be enabled or disabled in the
decorator, as well as by specifying an interval which is negative.

The spacing between runs of a periodic task is now specified in
seconds, with zero meaning the default spacing which is currently 60
seconds.

There is also a new argument to the decorator which indicates if a
periodic task _needs_ to be run in the nova-compute process. There is
also a flag (run_external_periodic_tasks) which can be used to move
these periodic tasks out of the nova-compute process.

I also remove the periodic_interval flag to services, as the interval
between runs is now dynamic based on the number of seconds that a
periodic task wants to wait for its next run. For callers who want to
twiddle the sleep period (for example unit tests), there is a
create() argument periodic_interval_max which lets the period
periodic_tasks() specifies be overridden. This is not exposed as a
flag because I cannot see a use case for that. It is needed for unit
testing however.

DocImpact. Resolves bug 939087.

Change-Id: I7f245a88b8d229a481c1b65a4c0f1e2769bf3901

commit_message:
tempest error codes should start with T

Because this was originally based on the nova hacking.py
the error codes were all N*. But now that we are owning it
in tempest they should be T*, as we're diverging.

Change the ignores to follow the errors that we're ignoring.

Change-Id: I7b23325da41a3942ae51ee3d29a49f54c75c57f8

commit_message:
add hacking.py rule to prevent docstrings

add new rule for hacking.py to catch and prevent docstrings on
test_ functions in the tempest/test directory. Found 2 oddballs
that I missed on the last conversion.

update ./run_tests.sh to not ingore all N4* errors (basically all
our custom rules), 401 and 402 still ignored because we actually
have a lot of errors on both of those.

Change-Id: I894d181433b7dcd1a9f4429f1a463be75018f05e

@Emilien
Thanks for writing the useful documents.
I have two questions on your original documents during working on the patch:
- Why do set use_namespaces = False?
- What is the background to set rp_filter=0? Do you experience some troubles with rp_filter=1?'}, {'account_id': 3153, 'date': '2012-12-31 09:54:36.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

(1 inline comment)

Thank's for review !

1) I don't use namespaces since they are not well suported in Folsom if you use OVS Plugin :

http://docs.openstack.org/trunk/openstack-network/admin/content/ch_limitations.html

2) I set rp_filter=0 because to disable the kernel's default setting which disallows asynchronous routing I met several times. 

3) Why did you delete the OVS configuration on the compute node ? -> http://docs.openstack.org/trunk/openstack-network/admin/content/install_quantum_agent_ovs.html

I'll merge after these fixs."}, {'account_id': 841, 'date': '2013-01-03 14:19:33.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: (1 inline comment)

Thanks for the review.

Regarding OVS configuration on the compute node, please see my inline comment. I believe I did not delete the configuration.

commit_message:
Brush up Quantum part of basic install guide

* Controller node
  * Add Horizon (Dashboard) URL in Dashboard Installation section
  * Correct the output of "glance image-list"
  * Remove Open vSwitch installation since OVS is not required on the
    controller node.
  * Remove dhcp_agent.ini configuration (fix bug 1091846)

* Network node
  * Fix parameter name 'gateway_external_network_id'
    in /etc/quantum/l3_agent.ini
  * Add auth_url setting to /etc/quantum/l3_agent.ini (fix bug 1091892)
  * Add rabbit_host setting to quantum.conf on the network node.
  * Correct sql_connection in ovs_quantum_plugin.ini to point to MySQL
    on the controller node (fix bug 1091888)

* Compute node
  * Move nova-api-metadata service to the controller node since metadata
    service is usually running on the controller node
  * Move Open vSwitch configuration into a separate section

* Common
  * Remove unnecessary 'ip_forward = 1' from controller and compute nodes
  * Remove unnecessasry /etc/quantum/api-paste.ini configurations
    from the network and compute nodes (fix bug 1091878)

Fix bug 1091846
Fix bug 1091878
Fix bug 1091888
Fix bug 1091892

Change-Id: Ifc0e70183b1cd28400346eb7606e993de74dcbc3

commit_message:
Revert "Temp fix for api/keystone.py"

commit_message:
Fixed unicode for object copy

Removed deprecated check for unicode symbols
in object names, fixed the reverse() for success_url,
which expects "/" to be included in path arguments.

Fixes bug 1008940

Change-Id: I1122437c40f8e31b64a82b39cd326141842ca519

(2 inline comments)

I proposed one minor doc enhancement in an inline comment, but it's up to you whether or not it's worth fixing. Other than that, looks good to me."}, {'account_id': 321, 'date': '2013-01-06 12:14:27.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-01-06 12:16:58.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Works for me

Build successful

- http://docs-draft.openstack.org/gate-openstack-cli-guide/check/54/cli/quick-start : SUCCESS
'}, {'account_id': 612, 'date': '2013-01-06 12:20:54.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

'}, {'account_id': 330, 'date': '2013-01-06 15:46:30.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

As a note of completeness, accounts and containers are stored similarly (just with the "object" part replaced with "account" or "container".

I'd add a trailing slash to the path to show that it's a directory (the directory is where all of the data for the object is stored, and the timestamp-named file [ie ${timestamp}.data] is where the actual data and metadata is stored). The directory is used for conflict resolution (ie last-write-wins, based on timestamp) and storing additional metadata (for a legacy, but still supported, set of options).

Note that what you are seeing here (the timestamp ordering and choosing the last one) is swift's conflict resolution implementation. Each piece of data  is assigned a timestamp by the proxy server when the request comes to the cluster, and that timestamp is what's used to name the file on disk on the object (or account or container) server.

I'd s/but for the general case/but for the common case/

I think this patch is fine, as is. I wanted to provide some more info in case it was needed. But I realize part of the art of docs is giving the right amount of info at the right time. That's for the doc maintainers to decide ;-)'}, {'account_id': 321, 'date': '2013-01-06 16:10:04.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 321, 'date': '2013-01-06 16:11:02.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

John:

I appreciate the feedback here. Since this is a reference guide, I'd like to err on the side of more detail. I made an attempt at describing the conflict resolution scheme in more detail."}, {'account_id': 321, 'date': '2013-01-06 16:11:39.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 321, 'date': '2013-01-06 16:11:56.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

typo (word appeared twice)'}, {'account_id': 330, 'date': '2013-01-06 16:13:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-01-06 16:14:09.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Works for me

Build successful

- http://docs-draft.openstack.org/gate-openstack-cli-guide/check/59/cli/quick-start : SUCCESS
'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-01-07 00:28:11.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: No score

Starting gate jobs.
http://zuul.openstack.org/'}, {'account_id': 612, 'date': '2013-01-07 00:28:11.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Looks good to me (core reviewer); Approved

commit_message:
How swift objects are layed out on filesystem

Implementation details on how Swift puts files on the filesystem.

Based on an email from John Dickisnon on the openstack mailing list.

(Also trims a lot of trailing whitespace from several lines in
this file).

Change-Id: I5665ec031b070856352051417d507b55735cc4d3

commit_message:
Pin docutils to 0.9.1, fix pep8 errors

Docutils 0.10 breaks manpage generation in sphinx 1.1.3. A fix to
sphinx has been merged, but not yet released (scheduled for dec
24-31). In the mean time, we should pin docutils to 0.9.1.

Also fixes new pep8 errors as reported by pep8 1.3.4.

Change-Id: Icedae7bf70c7feaf9f1631c3a2cc3bea67570956

commit_message:
Don't redirect when clicking instance detail page in admin panel.

Fixes bug 1096299.

Currently, when you click the instance detail information page
in admin panel, horzion will redirects to the project panel.
This is not reasonable. This patch fixes this problem by staying
on the admin panel when clicking the instance detail page.

Change-Id: Id589ab7de5d5c3c70831538268139b5286bd61bd

messages:
[{'account_id': 3, 'date': '2012-12-06 18:20:56.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Works for me

'}, {'account_id': 2284, 'date': '2012-12-07 11:46:27.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

(1 inline comment)

Hi Julie,

One nitpick inline.

Also I've a concern on the consistency of the user experience here (standard disclaimer: I'm not a UX expert, so feel free to ignore ...).

So basically the issue is that the launch button may be (a) greyed out in scenarios where a launch might actually have suceeded or (b) enabled where a launch is doomed to fail.

Granted, (a) mostly occurs on racy edge conditions, e.g. when a down-scaling resize is nearing confirmation, or an instance delete is in progress, so quota headroom is on the cusp of being freed up.

But a bigger concern would be (b) which may occur in at least two cases I can think of:

1. where the flavor that the user ends up selecting requires more cores or RAM than are available within the non-zero headroom

2. where an in-flight quota reservation results in the true headroom being less than that apparent from the number of existing resources (since openstack_dashboard.usage.quotas.tenant_quota_usages() tallies up current usage without taking into account the quota reservations for in-flight resource allocations).

Case b.2. could be addressed by calling out to the nova os-quota-sets API extension and requesting the usages, which will include both the in_use and reserved counts, instead of relying on quotas.tenant_quota_usages().

Cheers,
Eoghan"}, {'account_id': 4264, 'date': '2012-12-07 11:50:13.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: (1 inline comment)

'}, {'account_id': 4978, 'date': '2012-12-07 12:20:46.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

eglynn, I agree with what you said inline. I need to give more thought to the rest of your comment (and look a bit more into the different types of quotas and reservations).

mrunge, would you have alternative UI suggestions if not using Javascript? Returning True/False directly from allowed would make the button disappear completely (no Javascript dependency), which I found a very confusing user experience, especially if you don't realise the link with quotas."}, {'account_id': 4264, 'date': '2012-12-07 12:42:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

For the javascript disabled case, wouldn't it work to display a "quota exceeded" hint (or so).

I'm not a designer, so please don't take that as best solution ever.'}, {'account_id': 1816, 'date': '2012-12-09 21:20:00.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

(1 inline comment)

"}, {'account_id': 4978, 'date': '2012-12-12 15:05:06.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

I'm holding onto a new version of this patch addressing both the quotas with reservations and the UI concerns, pending an update to the nova client (https://review.openstack.org/#/c/17925/) (thank you Eoghan for your help with Nova!)."}, {'account_id': 4978, 'date': '2012-12-17 11:41:45.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 4978, 'date': '2012-12-17 11:44:50.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

The new patch uses limits and calculates remaining headroom more accurately (for instance the user won't have to wait anymore for an instance in "deleting" state to disappear before they can start a new one).

I tried another approach for the UX "inform the user" part. Using the messages framework at the info level would be nicer but I haven't yet found a way to display the message at the same time the page is loaded with the button disabled.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2012-12-17 11:58:32.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Doesn't seem to work

"}, {'account_id': 1297, 'date': '2012-11-03 06:23:08.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 7: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

Maybe I am just being naive, but with cells, it seems like there are many new error 'pathways' being added. It almost seems like there should be new docs added just for the new ways things can break and how it will recover.

Some examples:

1. When a child cell fails, what happens at the higher levels?
2. When a cell is disconnected from other cells, what happens on reconnect?
3. When a proxy cell call gets lost, how is this signaled. What kind of recovery is done? 

My concerns is that without proper orchestration existing in the first place to handle these issues in the simple  no-cells case that cells makes it even harder to get orchestration in place in the future."}, {'account_id': 1297, 'date': '2012-11-03 06:40:56.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7: (9 inline comments)

'}, {'account_id': 1297, 'date': '2012-11-03 06:44:34.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 7:

Also just concerned about how nova/other sevices using a single DB as shown at the grizzly design summit didn't even do transcations/constrains and data consistency right. A problem which the redhat folks showed, so adding cells makes it even harder to ensure cross cell type of consistency. Not that the later shouldn't be tried, it just needs to be very very thoroughly documented each scenairo and how the error/inconsistency will be resolved (especially when u add a tree of cells together)."}, {'account_id': 1030, 'date': '2012-11-03 07:09:19.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 7:

Josh: I think that I can clean some of these up real quick.  The api_map stuff is just... annoying... due to how I need to re-call compute_api with the current code.  Ideally there's a large refactor that eliminates this need... and cells becomes more of just a proxy between nova-api and the managers.

I'll go reply to other things inline soon, but a couple of other things:

instance uuids are generated at the API level and passed down.  The 'uuid' column in the instances table is a unique key up there, so you cannot possibly create duplicates.  No where in the implementation does Cells create a uuid in a child cell and send it up such that you'd need it unique globally.

Also, sure, there are a number of error possibilities that could occur here which are new.  Messages should not be lost due to using queues for messaging... but.. never say never!  Things can certainly get lost when you have messages in-flight and you kill the nova-cells service..  This is because the rpc code acks messages early.

Anyway, yes, we should document the potential failure cases."}, {'account_id': 1297, 'date': '2012-11-03 07:36:25.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 7: No score

Thanks, hoping all the different scenerios can get written down, since you would probably know what they are the best of anyone. I personally have lots of questions that I am sure others have (if not the same).

Another one, since there is a top level cell scheduler and the 'view' it has is potentially out of date, if a child cell says 'no' i can't really satisfy your needs... What happens? Does it retry?

What happens if things like keystone are not or accidentally put into child cells, what would occur?

What kind of cell level orchestration is there, ie an instance goes through states when its being created (there isn't an ochestration entity that tracks these yet in nova). It would seem like the same entity would need to exist for cells, since it has the same concept of states and state transitions. Is that correct?"}, {'account_id': 1297, 'date': '2012-11-03 17:58:00.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 7:

As you already know, but just want to re-iterate. I'd really like this to shape into a non-intrusive scheduling change since thats what the cells 'overlay' really is in the end. But I'll leave that up to the reviewers. 

http://wiki.openstack.org/SchedulingSplitout might be the proper way to fix this in the future."}, {'account_id': 1297, 'date': '2012-11-06 02:58:40.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7: (1 inline comment)

'}, {'account_id': 9, 'date': '2012-11-13 06:03:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7:

code review expired after 1 week of no activity after a negative review, it can be restored using the `Restore Change` button under the Patch Set on the web interface'}, {'account_id': 9, 'date': '2012-11-13 06:03:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7: Abandoned

code review expired after 1 week of no activity after a negative review, it can be restored using the `Restore Change` button under the Patch Set on the web interface'}, {'account_id': 2835, 'date': '2012-11-13 16:36:44.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 7:

I'm wondering if this would be easier to read & review if the main cells manager was broken up into logical sub-components.  

For example:

1) a message communication/routing
2) service api proxy
3) scheduler
4) capability/capacity management
5) instance (and other db?) syncing"}, {'account_id': 2835, 'date': '2012-11-13 16:37:14.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7:

'}, {'account_id': 1561, 'date': '2013-01-03 23:25:19.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 17: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

(5 inline comments)

Some smaller comments inline.

I'm inclined to get this merged ASAP.  I know it's used in production already and it's also self-contained.

One major thing that struck me with this is how compute.api gets called remotely.  I've always considered compute.api an internal API that isn't versioned and could completely change between releases.  This exposes that API between cells, which is concerning from an API stability point of view.  It also means that you can't do a rolling upgrade between cells (upgrade one whole cell, then the next one, etc).  I think we need to figure out a way to only use stable APIs between cells.

Perhaps we could consider marking cells experimental in Grizzly, pending stable API concerns being addressed, and feature parity with non-cells deployments (since I recall there being some things that won't work with cells right now?)."}, {'account_id': 1030, 'date': '2013-01-03 23:59:01.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 17: (3 inline comments)

I think the experimental label is fine no matter.

As far as the compute API stuff....  this is the biggest thing I do not like.  I talked to Vish about this a bit.  Ideally cells is just a proxy to the compute manager in a child cell.  Right now, the compute manager expects the instance to be in a certain state, however, set up by the compute API.  I think this is wrong.  (It means I must call compute API in child cell, since the DB is not shared).

I'd like nova-api to keep its own state about instances so it can allow/disallow requests.  Then let compute manager manage its own state of things.  I don't think these should be mixed the way they are today.  This does mean that compute will need to notify the API when certain things finish, but that's essentially how cells works.  Would be nice if non-cells worked similarly.  It's possible that somehow this could be done via nova-conductor.

I dunno for sure... but I don't have a good alternative immediately.  This is what spawned some of Vish's comments recently about needing to version the compute API. :)

Fixes to some of your comments going up.  I'd rather delay the 'classes specified in CONF' changes to after this beast merges."}, {'account_id': 1030, 'date': '2013-01-04 00:00:03.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 18.'}, {'account_id': 1030, 'date': '2013-01-04 00:03:58.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 19.'}, {'account_id': 1030, 'date': '2013-01-04 00:23:20.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 20.'}, {'account_id': 1030, 'date': '2013-01-04 01:14:22.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 21.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-01-04 01:56:22.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 21: Works for me

This is a lot of code, but it looks sane to me. It is also a significant piece of functionality that I think lots of people will be interested in using. I can't see any obvious problems apart from the compute-api stuff in here, and I'd rather bed it down in grizzly-2 than let is sit outside any longer.

Chris -- this is great work and I'm impressed.

I agree we should label this as experimental for grizzly."}, {'account_id': 1561, 'date': '2013-01-04 14:38:25.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 21: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

'}, {'created': '2013-01-04 17:49:54.000000000', 'message': "Cells: Add the main code.

This introduces *EXPERIMENTAL* compute cells functionality as a way to
scale nova in a more distributed fashion without having to use complicated
technologies like DB and message queue clustering.

Cells are configured as a tree and the top level cell should contain
nova-api without any nova-computes while child cells contain everything
except nova-api.  One can think of a cell as a normal nova deployment in
that each cell has its own DB server and message queue broker.

The top level cell keeps a subset of data about ALL instances in all
cells in its DB.  Child cells send messages to the top level cell when
instances change state.  Data in 1 child cell is not shared with another
child cell.

A new service, nova-cells, is introduced that handles communication
between cells and picking of a cell for new instances.  This service is
required for every cell.  Communication between cells is pluggable with
the only option currently implemented being communnication via RPC.

Cells scheduling is separate from host scheduling.  nova-cells first picks
a cell (currently randomly -- future patches add filtering/weighing
functionality and decisions can be based on broadcasts of
capacity/capabilities).  Once a cell has been selected and the new build
request has reached its nova-cells service, it'll be sent over to the host
scheduler in that cell and the build proceeds as it does without cells.

New config options are introduced for enabling and configuring the cells
code.  Cells is disabled by default.  All of the config options below go
under a '[cells]' section in nova.conf.  These are the options that one
may want to tweak:

enable -- Turn on cells code (default is False)
name -- Name of the current cell.
capabilities -- List of arbitrary key=value pairs defining capabilities
                of the current cell.  These are sent to parent cells,
                but aren't used in scheduling until later filter/weight
                support is added.
call_timeout -- How long to wait for replies from a calls between cells

When using cells, the compute API class must be changed in the API cell,
so that requests can be proxied via nova-cells down to the correct cell
properly.  Thus, config requirements for API cell:

--
[DEFAULT]
compute_api_class=nova.compute.cells_api.ComputeCellsAPI.
[cells]
enable=True
name=api-cell
--

Config requirements for child cell:

--
[cells]
enable=True
name=child-cell1
--

Another requirement is populating the 'cells' DB table in each cell.
Each cell needs to know about its parent and children and how to
communicate with them (message broker location, credentials, etc).

Implements blueprint nova-compute-cells

DocImpact

Change-Id: I1b52788ea9d7753365d175abf39bdbc22ba822fe

commit_message:
Cells: Add the main code.

This introduces *EXPERIMENTAL* compute cells functionality as a way to
scale nova in a more distributed fashion without having to use complicated
technologies like DB and message queue clustering.

Cells are configured as a tree and the top level cell should contain
nova-api without any nova-computes while child cells contain everything
except nova-api.  One can think of a cell as a normal nova deployment in
that each cell has its own DB server and message queue broker.

The top level cell keeps a subset of data about ALL instances in all
cells in its DB.  Child cells send messages to the top level cell when
instances change state.  Data in 1 child cell is not shared with another
child cell.

A new service, nova-cells, is introduced that handles communication
between cells and picking of a cell for new instances.  This service is
required for every cell.  Communication between cells is pluggable with
the only option currently implemented being communnication via RPC.

Cells scheduling is separate from host scheduling.  nova-cells first picks
a cell (currently randomly -- future patches add filtering/weighing
functionality and decisions can be based on broadcasts of
capacity/capabilities).  Once a cell has been selected and the new build
request has reached its nova-cells service, it'll be sent over to the host
scheduler in that cell and the build proceeds as it does without cells.

New config options are introduced for enabling and configuring the cells
code.  Cells is disabled by default.  All of the config options below go
under a '[cells]' section in nova.conf.  These are the options that one
may want to tweak:

enable -- Turn on cells code (default is False)
name -- Name of the current cell.
capabilities -- List of arbitrary key=value pairs defining capabilities
                of the current cell.  These are sent to parent cells,
                but aren't used in scheduling until later filter/weight
                support is added.
call_timeout -- How long to wait for replies from a calls between cells

When using cells, the compute API class must be changed in the API cell,
so that requests can be proxied via nova-cells down to the correct cell
properly.  Thus, config requirements for API cell:

--
[DEFAULT]
compute_api_class=nova.compute.cells_api.ComputeCellsAPI.
[cells]
enable=True
name=api-cell
--

Config requirements for child cell:

--
[cells]
enable=True
name=child-cell1
--

Another requirement is populating the 'cells' DB table in each cell.
Each cell needs to know about its parent and children and how to
communicate with them (message broker location, credentials, etc).

Implements blueprint nova-compute-cells

DocImpact

Change-Id: I1b52788ea9d7753365d175abf39bdbc22ba822fe

commit_message:
Don't log exceptions when image is not found

Just log a debug message and don't throw an exception if
the image has already been deleted

Fixes LP #1084703

Change-Id: I2d893b69276997ecd5a23553e51457e8cb23ca34

commit_message:
Describe image customizations to support resize.

Add a section to describe how images should be customized to support
OpenStack.

In particular, it adds a section that describes how to support
resizing partitions on boot.

Patchset has minor edits (wilil for will).

Cherry-picked from https://review.openstack.org/18804

Change-Id: I890f6cce5eeb11852f3e9dbb87e16afba1862d1a

revisions:
[{'created': '2012-12-09 13:07:53.000000000', 'message': "Add a generic Quantum VIF driver

This is part of blueprint vif-plugging-improvements.

The VIF driver QuantumVIFDriver has been added. This currently supports the
following vif types: 'ovs' and 'bridge'. Adding support for '802.1qbg' and
'802.1qbh' is pretty straight forward.

The patch does the following:
1. It enables a generic Quantum VIF driver to treat the vNic according to the
   type of vNic (that is, per the vif_type)
2. In order to be backward compatible and to enable plugable vif driver the
   following configuration variables have been added:
   i. libvirt_vif_default - a default driver in the event that the 'vif_type'
      is not received from Quantum (maybe an older version of Quantum)
   ii. libvirt_vif_ovs - the class to handle OVS drivers. This is configurable
      in order to enable the user to work with diffent libvirt versions, different
      OVS implementations etc.
   iii. libvirt_vif_bridge - the class to handle standard linux bridge drivers.

Change-Id: I409bbc951b4f1f5e4f301da014ef5f9519181b8f
"}, {'created': '2012-12-09 13:13:54.000000000', 'message': "Add a generic Quantum VIF driver

Change-Id: I409bbc951b4f1f5e4f301da014ef5f9519181b8f

The patch does the following:

2. In order to be backward compatible and to enable plugable vif driver the

   i. libvirt_vif_default - a default driver in the event that the 'vif_type'

commit_message:
Add a generic Quantum VIF driver

This is part of blueprint vif-plugging-improvements.

The VIF driver QuantumVIFDriver has been added. This currently supports the
following vif types: 'ovs' and 'bridge'. Adding support for '802.1qbg' and
'802.1qbh' is pretty straight forward.

The patch does the following:
1. It enables a generic Quantum VIF driver to treat the vNic according to the
   type of vNic (that is, per the vif_type)
2. In order to be backward compatible and to enable plugable vif driver the
   following configuration variables have been added:
   i. libvirt_vif_default - a default driver in the event that the 'vif_type'
      is not received from Quantum (maybe an older version of Quantum)
   ii. libvirt_vif_ovs - the class to handle OVS drivers. This is configurable
      in order to enable the user to work with diffent libvirt versions, different
      OVS implementations etc.
   iii. libvirt_vif_bridge - the class to handle standard linux bridge drivers.

Change-Id: I409bbc951b4f1f5e4f301da014ef5f9519181b8f

commit_message:
Optionally add message envelope to notifications.

When message envelopes were added for rpc messages, notifications were
explicitly left out.  This was due to the fact that notifications are
consumed outside of OpenStack.  However, notification consumers will
likely want to eventually start taking advantage of some of the features
that the envelope is a prerequisite for, such as message signing.

This patch adds a new notification driver that produces message based
notifications including the message envelope.

Related to blueprint version-rpc-messages.

Change-Id: Iaa8b437e6b4f64053f4b02bf486516f60bb020e9

commit_message:
Add conditions in compute APIRouter

The Route of versions should add HTTP GET methods conditions, because
it only has a 'show' action, thus other methods will not match.

Fixes bug 1088530

Change-Id: Ib21381324cf7067015d0a6e36a0f0292eb902fe9

commit_message:
improve libguestfs exception handling

* nova/virt/disk/vfs/guestfs.py (teardown): Handle specific
exceptions when tearing down so that (future) nova bugs
aren't masked.  Also handle AttributeError so that the
relatively new handle() and close() don't cause erroneous
debug logs on older versions of libguestfs.
(has_file): remove the last use of generic exception
catching and use the more specific RuntimeError.

Change-Id: Ia7345675d75c1c6727e9254791d44475c0ed9295

'}, {'account_id': 1711, 'date': '2012-11-15 15:57:33.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

I like the idea of having more detailed task states in snapshot! What I'm not sure about this is that now there is a update_task_state() function, which is essentially a db call that gets passed into the driver. This seems to be against the move of no-db-compute. 

An alternative solution would be to split the snapshot() driver function into three stages as three driver methods: snapshot_to_local(), prepare_snapshot_image(), and upload_snapshot_image() so that the manager can update the task state instead of doing it in the driver."}, {'account_id': 4393, 'date': '2012-11-15 16:11:33.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

(1 inline comment)

I think that from the no-db-compute perspective, this is okay. The db call is being made (a) properly with the manager's own instance update function and (b) in the manager, not the virt driver, which could be refactored later (into either a virtapi call or a notification or something) without modifying the virt driver.

Technically, we've been moving any callbacks from the driver to the compute manager into the VirtAPI object for cleanliness. Those are mostly replacements of database calls right now. This doesn't really fit that model exactly, in that it's a small localized state update callback, specific to the snapshot operation.

So, you could move it into VirtAPI and make it a formal interface, or you could keep it where you've got it (fixing the point I noted in the code). I'm fine with either, although I lean towards leaving it where you have it."}, {'account_id': 5387, 'date': '2012-11-15 17:53:14.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 5387, 'date': '2012-11-15 18:02:31.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

Thanks Dan, changing that away from kwargs actually simplified that function quite a bit!

In reference to no-db-compute, my sentiments are fairly close to Dan's. What I've seen so far is that the first push of the effort will be simply moving db calls to a separate service. In this case, this function call would be replaced with an equivalent call to that service."}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2012-11-15 18:12:47.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Works for me

commit_message:
Adding two snapshot related task states

The first, 'image_pending_upload', indicates that the snapshot of a given
instance has been taken and it is being prepared for uploading to the
image service.

The second, 'image_uploading', indicates that the compute manager has
initiated upload to the image service.

Implements blueprint snapshot-task-states

Change-Id: I256c5d21a1d23b87d2060cca99eb9839c5b89161

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-01-03 16:08:33.000000000', 'message': 'Upgrade WebOb to 1.2.3

The version of WebOb being used in OpenStack was more than
1 year old. This change updates to the latest stable release.

Upgrading WebOb resolves a version conflict between OpenStack
and Pecan, the web framework used by the Ceilometer team for
version 2 of the ceilometer API.

Refer to http://docs.webob.org/en/latest/news.html
for the list of changes between 1.0.8 and 1.2.3.

bug 1092227

Change-Id: If68866122e6c492b03887af5953ab7cad01787ba
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug.hellmann@dreamhost.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Upgrade WebOb to 1.2.3

The version of WebOb being used in OpenStack was more than
1 year old. This change updates to the latest stable release.

Upgrading WebOb resolves a version conflict between OpenStack
and Pecan, the web framework used by the Ceilometer team for
version 2 of the ceilometer API.

Refer to http://docs.webob.org/en/latest/news.html
for the list of changes between 1.0.8 and 1.2.3.

bug 1092227

Change-Id: If68866122e6c492b03887af5953ab7cad01787ba
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug.hellmann@dreamhost.com>

commit_message:
Fix keystone *-list order by 'name'

'keystone user-list' is order by 'name' now.(see bug 1073437)
But {role, service, tenant, user-role}-list are not. So this patch fixes these.

Fixes bug 1091894

Change-Id: I1876d0b1e1ea625efe91c3f8261bafd2bf34b0de

revisions:
[{'created': '2012-12-23 02:59:31.000000000', 'message': "Database metadata performance optimizations

In instance_metadata_update():
Fix bug: there was no transaction in method.
Performance optimization:
let N is number of metadata items.
Was:
*) 1 request to get all (M) existing in DB entries
*) (M-L) requests to get all entries that don't exist in metadata
*) (M-L) requests to soft delete all entries
*) N request to try to get get metadata by key from DB
*) N request to save
Now:
*) 1 requst to soft delete entries that exist in DB and don't exist in metadata
*) 1 requst to get all(L) entries that exist in metadata and DB
*) L request to update all L entries that exist in DB and metadata
*) N-L request to create new entries.
result 1 + 2*(M - L + N) -> 2 + N

In instance_system_metadata_update():
Fix bug: there was no transaction in method.
Same performance situation.

In aggregate_metadata_get:
Fix bug: there was no transaction at all in method.
Performance optimization:
Let N is number of metadata items.
All request have check that Aggregate exist so each time there are 2 request.
Was:
*) 1 + 1 request to get all (M) entries that exist in DB
*) (1 + 1)*(M-L) request to get each entry that exist in DB and doesn't exist in metadata
*) (1 + 1)*(M-L) to soft delete entries
*) N * (1 + 1) try to get each item that exist in metadata
*) N * (1 + 1) update or save
Now:
*) 1 request to get query object if exist Aggregate
*) 1 request to soft delete or entries that exist in DB and doesn't exit in metadata
*) 1 request to get elements that exist in DB and in metadata
*) L request to update existing metadata
*) N - L request to create new metadata
2 + 4*(M - L) + 4*N -> 3 + N

blueprint db-session-cleanup

Change-Id: Ie14f89c567c971dece34cc3659ad3a48cf82acf6
"}]
commit_message:
Database metadata performance optimizations

In instance_metadata_update():
Fix bug: there was no transaction in method.
Performance optimization:
let N is number of metadata items.
Was:
*) 1 request to get all (M) existing in DB entries
*) (M-L) requests to get all entries that don't exist in metadata
*) (M-L) requests to soft delete all entries
*) N request to try to get get metadata by key from DB
*) N request to save
Now:
*) 1 requst to soft delete entries that exist in DB and don't exist in metadata
*) 1 requst to get all(L) entries that exist in metadata and DB
*) L request to update all L entries that exist in DB and metadata
*) N-L request to create new entries.
result 1 + 2*(M - L + N) -> 2 + N

In instance_system_metadata_update():
Fix bug: there was no transaction in method.
Same performance situation.

In aggregate_metadata_get:
Fix bug: there was no transaction at all in method.
Performance optimization:
Let N is number of metadata items.
All request have check that Aggregate exist so each time there are 2 request.
Was:
*) 1 + 1 request to get all (M) entries that exist in DB
*) (1 + 1)*(M-L) request to get each entry that exist in DB and doesn't exist in metadata
*) (1 + 1)*(M-L) to soft delete entries
*) N * (1 + 1) try to get each item that exist in metadata
*) N * (1 + 1) update or save
Now:
*) 1 request to get query object if exist Aggregate
*) 1 request to soft delete or entries that exist in DB and doesn't exit in metadata
*) 1 request to get elements that exist in DB and in metadata
*) L request to update existing metadata
*) N - L request to create new metadata
2 + 4*(M - L) + 4*N -> 3 + N

blueprint db-session-cleanup

Change-Id: Ie14f89c567c971dece34cc3659ad3a48cf82acf6

commit_message:
Fix regression in RetryFilter

Fixes regression in RetryFilter.  The RPC layer would convert the list
of tuples that comprised the previously attempted hosts to a list of
lists.  The RetryFilter was attempting to compare a tuple to a list,
which failed.

bug 1096196

Change-Id: I30adf42daf5e86ccec0269eca1f84d06ed4beb59

commit_message:
livbirt: have a single source of console log file naming.

We were generating the path to the console log for libvirt in multiple
places. This was just confusing. Let's have a single source of how
these files are named.

Change-Id: Iac3654c7f4fd68347b0fcc78f303b76f2bd1586c

 keypair_create_response.xml
 keypair_list.json
 Keypair_publickey_create_request.json
 keypair_publickey_create_request.xml

Build Successful

Patchset just rebases against master to pick up 1.5.2 in the pom.xml.

Fixes: bug 1095720

Change-Id: Ie326532763734bd9ea5edcd68580f8634c198ecd

commit_message:
Add ping to conductor

This adds a ping() method to conductor, which takes a single
argument and returns it back to the caller. It also returns
the name of the current service, which is always 'conductor' in
this case. I did this because I think that a generic ping method
should do this in order to facilitate blind or broadcast pings.

Related to bp/no-db-compute-manager

Change-Id: I83105060945fa6a793d884c9e06ff154bc98e715

commit_message:
Clean up setting of control_exchange default

The RPC code from Oslo now registers the control_exchange option but
provides us with an API for changing the default.

blueprint: scope-config-opts
Change-Id: Ie7950daaddb53f38eb72d2a113e1f26252dd6903

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-01-04 18:06:10.000000000', 'message': "update version urls to working v2 urls

the GET /v2/ API call is documented to return urls to both
wadl and pdf documents. However our call returned non working
urls to 1.1 versions of those documents. Fix this.

Also fix the unit tests to actually test the output of versions.
Previously we were over stubbing the test_verions.py so it was
testing only itself, and not the output you'd actually get from
the real versions.py module.

Renamed the variables used for the expected variables to reduce
confusion about what is an expected variable vs. the variables
coming from versions.py to try to ensure we don't have cicular
always passing tests in the future.

Fixes bug https://bugs.launchpad.net/nova/+bug/1076109

Change-Id: I1047b8c48ff053eed5ad4afa8eae5833f70d0893

commit_message:
update version urls to working v2 urls

the GET /v2/ API call is documented to return urls to both
wadl and pdf documents. However our call returned non working
urls to 1.1 versions of those documents. Fix this.

Also fix the unit tests to actually test the output of versions.
Previously we were over stubbing the test_verions.py so it was
testing only itself, and not the output you'd actually get from
the real versions.py module.

Renamed the variables used for the expected variables to reduce
confusion about what is an expected variable vs. the variables
coming from versions.py to try to ensure we don't have cicular
always passing tests in the future.

Fixes bug #1076109

Change-Id: I1047b8c48ff053eed5ad4afa8eae5833f70d0893

revisions:
[{'created': '2012-11-21 11:31:58.000000000', 'message': "Cells: Add periodic instance healing

Adds a periodic task that'll sync instance information to API cells
periodically.  Does a handful of instances per periodic task run based
on config values.

instance_update_interval      -- Number of seconds between syncing
instance_updated_at_threshold -- Number of seconds after an instance was
                                 updated or deleted to continue to sync
                                 (Ie, don't sync instances updated more
                                 than 'x' seconds ago.)
instance_update_num_instances -- Number of instances to update per periodic
                                 task run

Implements blueprint nova-compute-cells

DocImpact

Change-Id: I3103c3a69ab9cf0ec3e399abe046ed0d216234ab

                                 (Ie, don't sync instances updated more
                                 than 'x' seconds ago.)
instance_update_num_instances -- Number of instances to update per periodic
                                 task run

Implements blueprint nova-compute-cells

DocImpact

commit_message:
Cells: Add periodic instance healing

Adds a periodic task that'll sync instance information to API cells
periodically.  Does a handful of instances per periodic task run based
on config values.  Instances picked for syncing are randomized so that
multiple nova-cells services won't be syncing the same instances at
nearly the same time.

instance_updated_at_threshold -- Number of seconds after an instance was
                                 updated or deleted to continue to sync
                                 (Ie, don't sync instances updated more
                                 than 'x' seconds ago.)
instance_update_num_instances -- Number of instances to update per periodic
                                 task run

Implements blueprint nova-compute-cells

DocImpact

Change-Id: I3103c3a69ab9cf0ec3e399abe046ed0d216234ab

commit_message:
Timeout individual tests after one minute.

Use fixtures.Timeout to timeout each nova test after one minute of
running. Because only one fixtures.Timeout can be in use at a time
subclasses of nova.test.TestCase should not explicitly use this fixture.

Change-Id: I0fced73e81784d0f843ecac2998598a0343a2083

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-01-04 18:42:18.000000000', 'message': 'Move service_get_all operations to conductor

This patch adds a single service_get_all_by() method to the
conductor, which services the following database calls:

 - service_get_all()
 - service_get_all_by_topic()
 - service_get_all_by_host()
 - service_get_by_host_and_topic()
 - service_get_all_compute_by_host()

It also makes compute/manager use conductor for this case.
The special case for the service_get_all_compute_by_host() call
is rather unfortunate, and I wonder if it might be okay to (later)
make the generic function automatically joinedload in the compute
case.

Related to blueprint no-db-compute-manager

Change-Id: Ib4aa10a3196a4b9aa779f57f4e5d6b136676f3bd

commit_message:
Move service_get_all operations to conductor

This patch adds a single service_get_all_by() method to the
conductor, which services the following database calls:

 - service_get_all()
 - service_get_all_by_topic()
 - service_get_all_by_host()
 - service_get_by_host_and_topic()
 - service_get_all_compute_by_host()

It also makes compute/manager use conductor for this case.
The special case for the service_get_all_compute_by_host() call
is rather unfortunate, and I wonder if it might be okay to (later)
make the generic function automatically joinedload in the compute
case.

Related to blueprint no-db-compute-manager

Change-Id: Ib4aa10a3196a4b9aa779f57f4e5d6b136676f3bd

migration_get_unconfirmed_by_dest_compute to the conductor.

Related to blueprint no-db-compute-manager

Move vol_usage methods to conductor

to conductor:

 - vol_usage_update()
 - vol_get_usage_by_time()

Related to blueprint no-db-compute-manager

commit_message:
Use full instance in virt driver volume usage

Right now, the virt driver method get_all_volume_usage() returns
a list of items, including the instance uuid. In order to pass
the results of this over to conductor (which will demand a full
instance), this patch converts the structure to include it.

It appears that only libvirt implements this method, and the change
is fairly trivial.

Related to blueprint no-db-compute-manager

Change-Id: Ia8001727b57442ef0ecc2c161201f1a617e199d4

commit_message:
Fix test cases in tests.unit.test_service

Be patient in test_service while waiting service to be spawned or killed,
because:
    * Service spawning has a limit of one process a second.
    * A test server in the cloud might have limited resources, the time there
      might be several times slower.

Change-Id: Idab1d1158ecc7564d0b1f9cdd32496496ff5b3f8

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-01-02 14:55:40.000000000', 'message': 'Ensure proxy callback threads exit during tests

On the consumer side, each message is consumed in a separate thread
but we currently have no way of waiting for all these threads to
complete.

In BaseRpcTestCase.test_call_timeout(), we complete the thread while
there is still a message handler running on the other side. This can
mean the consumer attempting to send its reply while other tests
are running, which clearly is a bad thing.

Make the connection close() and reset() methods in the kombu and qpid
drivers wait on proxy object threads before returning to avoid this
situation.

Change-Id: I8fb84b1dc7f31196ef27a5d1f8c4a3346b03e0ae
'}, {'created': '2013-01-03 07:33:45.000000000', 'message': 'Ensure proxy callback threads exit during tests

On the consumer side, each message is consumed in a separate thread
but we currently have no way of waiting for all these threads to
complete.

In BaseRpcTestCase.test_call_timeout(), we complete the thread while
there is still a message handler running on the other side. This can
mean the consumer attempting to send its reply while other tests
are running, which clearly is a bad thing.

Make the connection close() and reset() methods in the kombu and qpid
drivers wait on proxy object threads before returning to avoid this
situation.

Change-Id: I8fb84b1dc7f31196ef27a5d1f8c4a3346b03e0ae
'}]
commit_message:
Ensure proxy callback threads exit during tests

On the consumer side, each message is consumed in a separate thread
but we currently have no way of waiting for all these threads to
complete.

In BaseRpcTestCase.test_call_timeout(), we complete the thread while
there is still a message handler running on the other side. This can
mean the consumer attempting to send its reply while other tests
are running, which clearly is a bad thing.

Make the connection close() and reset() methods in the kombu and qpid
drivers wait on proxy object threads before returning to avoid this
situation.

Change-Id: I8fb84b1dc7f31196ef27a5d1f8c4a3346b03e0ae

to the conductor.

Related to blueprint no-db-compute-manager

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-01-02 19:37:09.000000000', 'message': 'Fix race in resource tracker

Fix a race in resource tracker where usage can get under reported if the
audit process runs after an instance gets set to vm_state=DELETED, but
before the DB record itself is deleted.

bug 1095403

Change-Id: I47943d12155a6484c6cb3adb31dfa4db0191cf26
'}]
commit_message:
Fix race in resource tracker

Fix a race in resource tracker where usage can get under reported if the
audit process runs after an instance gets set to vm_state=DELETED, but
before the DB record itself is deleted.

bug 1095403

Change-Id: I47943d12155a6484c6cb3adb31dfa4db0191cf26

and supports the following APIs through that method:

commit_message:
Move instance_get_*() to conductor

This patch adds conductor support for instance_get_all_by_filters(),
and supports the following APIs through that method:

 - instance_get_all()
 - instance_get_all_by_host()
 - instance_get_all_by_filters()

Further, it adds support for the following APIs:

 - instance_get_all_hung_in_rebooting()
 - instance_get_active_by_window()

It also makes compute/manager use conductor for these operations, with
one exception. Currently, ComputeManager.init_host () lists all
instances associated with the host, which may happen before a conductor
service is available. This will be handled separately due to the
sequencing concerns.

Related to bp/no-db-compute-manager

Change-Id: I0dd346fd632aa15cd301386bc392502b95709529

commit_message:
Checks guest status during migration.

During a migration, waits for the guest and service to start up
following the status change to VERIFY_RESIZE. Confirms if everything is
all right, or reverts if not.

Implements blueprint migration-check-guest-status

Change-Id: Ibf78360814543c184e079625a67c6e6c0b905cb5

commit_message:
Add an iptables mangle rule per-bridge for DHCP.

When vhost-net is present on a host, and DHCP services are
run on the same system as guests (multi_host), an iptables
rule is needed to fill packet checksums.  This adds a rule
per-bridge for multi_host networks when vhost-net is present,
similar to how newer versions of libvirt handle the issue for
bridges/networks that it manages.

Fixes LP: #1029430

EDIT: Updated tests and pep8.

(Backported from commit 901a3dacb6f2d36cbe8d23707dba75452e91df33)

Change-Id: I1a51c1d808fa47a77e713dbfe384ffad183d6031

commit_message:
Remove system_metadata db calls from compute manager

The compute/manager makes several unnecessary db calls to fetch
the instance system_metadata, which is available in the instance
object itself now. This patch replaces those uses, avoiding the
need to farm them out to conductor.

Related to bp/no-db-compute
Related to bp/no-db-compute-manager

Change-Id: I26ff77be17eb538a4fcd238ffe52f8bde4fbe3e0

commit_message:
Move block_device_mapping destroy operations to conductor

This patch moves the compute/manager's use of block_device_mapping_destroy
operations to the conductor. Specifically:

 - block_device_mapping_destroy()
 - block_device_mapping_destroy_by_instance_and_device()
 - block_device_mapping_destroy_by_instance_and_volume()

Once again, this just adds a single destroy operation to the conductor's
RPC API and replicates the older interfaces in the public API. Further,
the first now takes a list of bdms to be destroyed (unlike the db
operation it mirrors) so that multiple RPC calls can be avoided for
bulk delete operations.

Related to blueprint no-db-compute-manager

Change-Id: Ib93184ee6d32fcda90f75a26b579787e4625e9ae

commit_message:
Move block_device_mapping get operations to conductor

This patch moves the block_device_mapping_get_by_instance()
uses from compute/manager to the conductor. This also includes
some nasty refactoring in some of compute's helper methods to
pass around instances instead of just uuids so that we can
properly pass the former to the conductor.

Related to blueprint no-db-compute-manager

Change-Id: Ib5223274d21096a9e47b3420c3de801b978b253d

[{'created': '2013-01-02 19:48:56.000000000', 'message': 'Move block_device_mapping update operations to conductor

This patch moves the uses of the following methods in compute/manager
to the conductor:

 - block_device_mapping_create()
 - block_device_mapping_update()
 - block_device_mapping_update_or_create()

As in the past with adding multiple similar operations to conductor,
only one method is actually added to the manager and RPC API, which
is similar to the update_or_create variant above. The public API for
conductor maintains all three variants and their original calling
conventions.

Related to blueprint no-db-compute-manager

Change-Id: Ibcb721ebd0ba8639ccb2ba2f7bed1dcf499e4edb
'}]
commit_message:
Move block_device_mapping update operations to conductor

This patch moves the uses of the following methods in compute/manager
to the conductor:

 - block_device_mapping_create()
 - block_device_mapping_update()
 - block_device_mapping_update_or_create()

As in the past with adding multiple similar operations to conductor,
only one method is actually added to the manager and RPC API, which
is similar to the update_or_create variant above. The public API for
conductor maintains all three variants and their original calling
conventions.

Related to blueprint no-db-compute-manager

Change-Id: Ibcb721ebd0ba8639ccb2ba2f7bed1dcf499e4edb

commit_message:
fix floating-ip in multihost case

Fixes bug 1091698.

_disassociate_floating_ip and _associate_floating_ip got an extra
parameter since this change:
https://github.com/openstack/nova/commit/b93e851c0d90c17868a0e68a3b54e136bb5cd54d
However, the multi-host codepath was not amended, thus multihost case
is broken since that. This fix adds the extra parameters for those rpc
calls.

Change-Id: I93a5f96ef87c0f8a14c912d7812c001d0c682afa

[{'created': '2013-01-03 13:47:14.000000000', 'message': "Remove unused VMWare VIF driver abstraction

There is only a single VMWare VIF driver impl and that is
entirely a no-op in the plug & unplug methods. The VMWare
driver does call a 'ensure_vlan_bridge' method, which is
essentially a static helper for creating a bridge device.

Remove the VMWareVlanBridgeDriver class entirely and simply
have a single static method instead

Change-Id: I7d0873798e0e7261e17e8894237fd4339be7c3cd
Signed-off-by: Daniel P. Berrange <berrange@redhat.com>
"}, {'created': '2013-01-03 15:01:35.000000000', 'message': "Remove unused VMWare VIF driver abstraction

There is only a single VMWare VIF driver impl and that is
entirely a no-op in the plug & unplug methods. The VMWare
driver does call a 'ensure_vlan_bridge' method, which is
essentially a static helper for creating a bridge device.

Remove the VMWareVlanBridgeDriver class entirely and simply
have a single static method instead

Change-Id: I7d0873798e0e7261e17e8894237fd4339be7c3cd
Signed-off-by: Daniel P. Berrange <berrange@redhat.com>
"}]
commit_message:
Remove unused VMWare VIF driver abstraction

There is only a single VMWare VIF driver impl and that is
entirely a no-op in the plug & unplug methods. The VMWare
driver does call a 'ensure_vlan_bridge' method, which is
essentially a static helper for creating a bridge device.

Remove the VMWareVlanBridgeDriver class entirely and simply
have a single static method instead

Change-Id: I7d0873798e0e7261e17e8894237fd4339be7c3cd
Signed-off-by: Daniel P. Berrange <berrange@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Invalid EC2 ids should make the entire request fail.

Resolves bug 836978. I suspect there are many other cases where we
should add this check.

Change-Id: I027e44db2e27eb1ef913ddad8560cca08388906b

commit_message:
Use basestring instead of str for type check.

Change-Id: I1dbf453cc08bd8aaeb4fee2491a1e8aa74f8bee3 introduced some
checks to is_older_than and is_newer_than functions against str instead
of basestring.

I'm aware that basestring doesn't exist in Python3 but since it isn't
a target right now and there's no "standard" way to support it right now
in openstack.

Change-Id: I8d67d384637dfdde3f5621052d8511e7b6ecab7b
