word "overLimit" and "limit" in resp_body and resp_body[message]
respectively so as to confirm if it is a absolute-limited call.
If absolute limited call is confirmed, OverLimit exception is raised
without any re-try for request.
Then comes the check for depth < MAX_RECURSION_DEPTH, if it is true,
re-drive towards request call occurs.
But, the word "limit" also appears in the message of ratelimited call.
Hence it is incorrect to raise OverLimit exception without re-try when
word "limit" is present in the message of response.
Thus changed the word to "Quota" instead of "limit".
Fixes: bug #1093573

Change-Id: Iadd94c18668096d7e4795631337230ec36e9c4b9

When 413 error code is encountered for a request, it checks for the
word "overLimit" and "limit" in resp_body and resp_body[message]
respectively so as to confirm if it is a absolute-limited call.
If absolute limited call is confirmed, OverLimit exception is raised
without any re-try for request.
Then comes the check for depth < MAX_RECURSION_DEPTH, if it is true,

But, the word "limit" also appears in the message of ratelimited call.
Hence it is incorrect to raise OverLimit exception without re-try when
word "limit" is present in the message of response.

Fixes: bug #1093573

Change-Id: Iadd94c18668096d7e4795631337230ec36e9c4b9

commit_message:
Logic in rest_client incorrect "resp.status=413"

rest_client is NOT redriving rate limited calls for the second time.
When 413 error code is encountered for a request, it checks for the
word "overLimit" and "limit" in resp_body and resp_body[message]
respectively so as to confirm if it is a absolute-limited call.
If absolute limited call is confirmed, OverLimit exception is raised
without any re-try for request.
Then comes the check for depth < MAX_RECURSION_DEPTH, if it is true,
re-drive towards request call occurs.
But, the word "limit" also appears in the message of ratelimited call.
Hence it is incorrect to raise OverLimit exception without re-try when
word "limit" is present in the message of response.
Thus changed the word to "exceeded" instead of "limit".
Fixes: bug #1093573

Change-Id: Iadd94c18668096d7e4795631337230ec36e9c4b9

commit_message:
Set promisc mode on vlan bridge

Instances cannot communicate through the network because VLAN
bridge is not in PROMISC mode and it has the associated IP address
for nova-network

Fixes LP #1052776

Change-Id: I3bdfc3b2fe144d640b588a48b174e96736f2c2c5

commit_message:
Add fake env support to baremetal

Use bm_poseur to create VM and network bridge
so that, in the absence of physical hardware,
baremetal driver still has something to manipulate.

Change-Id: Id80ede13a35e4380f358b47f08d41ff98ea9d70f

commit_message:
adding support for baremetal hypervisor

New files for baremetal driver:
- lib/baremetal
- files/apts/baremetal

Adds two dependencies:
- google shell-in-a-box
- diskimage-builder

Enable by setting both:
  VIRT_DRIVER=baremetal
  ENABLED_SERVICES="$ENABLED_SERVICES,baremetal"

Change-Id: Ibf6fe1671a759a449c9eb0df47751d1b31ade591

revisions:
[{'created': '2012-12-28 00:22:25.000000000', 'message': 'Handle the new behaviour for invalid instances.

The behaviour of this case changed with bug/836978. Requesting the
status of an invalid instance will now return an error message
including the instance id, so we need to filter that out.

Resolves the devstack elements of bug 836978.

Change-Id: I385eb6f04cff90e1ddc0b79d835fbbdf92e4e9ff
'}]
commit_message:
Handle the new behaviour for invalid instances.

The behaviour of this case changed with bug/836978. Requesting the
status of an invalid instance will now return an error message
including the instance id, so we need to filter that out.

Resolves the devstack elements of bug 836978.

Change-Id: I385eb6f04cff90e1ddc0b79d835fbbdf92e4e9ff

commit_message:
Fix Glance control exchange

The name used is wrong, this is actually the named of notification topic
that was used until Folsom. The control exchange is and always has been
'glance'.

Change-Id: I86a46d28af22b663af804caf1a224b9dba73d38f
Signed-off-by: Julien Danjou <julien@danjou.info>

[{'created': '2012-12-12 12:38:29.000000000', 'message': 'Ground work for transifex-ify ceilometer.

Following http://wiki.openstack.org/Translations to integrate transifex
translation into ceilometer and to fix bug 1082805.

This is the ground work to enable translation jobs using transifex and
Jenkin's in ceilometer. We added the empty file
ceiloemter/locale/ceilometer.pot to avoid the failure of the Jenkin's
translation-jobs because git doesn't allow empty directory to be added
into the repository.

We still need to do the following things once this patch gets accepted:

1. Make the transifex ceilometer project
(https://www.transifex.com/projects/p/ceilometer/) as part of the
openstack transifex project hub and give access to the transifex
openstack Jenkins account.

2. Add the translation-jobs into openstack/openstack-ci-puppet for
ceilometer.

3. Recheck and/or clean the LOG.foobar strings in ceilometer so that
only the useful and necessary strings would be extracted into the .pot
file.

NOTE:
1. Don't use '_' as the variable name for "don't care", since it clashes
with gettext module.

2. Wrap the string with the underscore function to make it ready for
translation, e.g.

  internationalized_string = _("I'm internationalized!")
  LOG.debug(_('I speak the language of %(language)s'), locals())

Change-Id: I9732e424b374afa8f0650baf4e3537109e7520d1
'}, {'created': '2012-12-18 02:18:26.000000000', 'message': 'Ground work for transifex-ify ceilometer.

commit_message:
Ground work for transifex-ify ceilometer.

Following http://wiki.openstack.org/Translations to integrate transifex
translation into ceilometer and to fix bug 1082805.

This is the ground work to enable translation jobs using transifex and
Jenkin's in ceilometer. We added the empty file
ceilometer/locale/ceilometer.pot to avoid the failure of the Jenkin'
translation-jobs because git doesn't allow empty directory to be added
into the repository.

We still need to do the following things once this patch gets accepted:

1. Make the transifex ceilometer project
(https://www.transifex.com/projects/p/ceilometer/) as part of the
openstack transifex project hub and give access to the transifex
openstack Jenkins account.

2. Add the translation-jobs into openstack/openstack-ci-puppet for
ceilometer.

3. Recheck and/or clean the LOG.foobar strings in ceilometer so that
only the useful and necessary strings would be extracted into the .pot
file.

NOTE:
1. Don't use '_' as the variable name for "don't care", since it clashes
with gettext module.

2. Wrap the string with the underscore function to make it ready for
translation, e.g.

  internationalized_string = _("I'm internationalized!")
  LOG.debug(_('I speak the language of %(language)s'), locals())

Change-Id: I9732e424b374afa8f0650baf4e3537109e7520d1

commit_message:
Add instance_type information to NetPollster

Add instance type information for network measurement so that CW
publisher can create the instance_type dimensions. Currently this
information is lost.

Change-Id: I579b7187092f422fba38ea0ec296d05708b710d1
Signed-off-by: Yunhong, Jiang <yunhong.jiang@intel.com>

commit_message:
Remove lxc attaching/detaching of volumes

Remove lxc attach and detach of volumes since this
will be handled by libvirt in upcoming versions of
libvirt.

This is expected to be in libvirt 1.0.1 or 1.0.2.
This resolves (LP: #1067638) and (LP: #1009701)

This removes a non-functional feature of the
lxc driver with functionalilty that is coming
with newer versions of libvirt.

Change-Id: Iaf4bc2769632ba2e7dcfc67892dded7b4dfbb3ae
Signed-off-by: Chuck Short <chuck.short@canonical.com>

'}, {'account_id': 2759, 'date': '2012-12-26 01:00:42.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 11: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

I still believe driver should raise exception when DB and backend is out of sync.  I'll ask for options from other people.  So -1 here for now.  If everybody agree that end user shouldn't notice out-of-sync issue, I'll remove -1.  The rest of the code looks fine to me.

Thanks for the effort, Xing."}, {'account_id': 6491, 'date': '2012-12-26 01:52:39.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 11:

Thanks Zhiteng.  If there's another way for Cinder DB to get in sync with the backend array again, that will be great.  If I throw an exception here, it will leave a volume entry with error status in Cinder DB.  End user can never get rid of that entry (displayed in Horizon as red Error status) until he/she removes it from Cinder mysql DB.  That's ugly.  End user shouldn't have to manipulate the sql database directly.  He/She should be able to use Horizon to remove a volume that does not exist any more. 
Let me know if there's a better way to get around it.  Thanks!"}, {'account_id': 4355, 'date': '2012-12-26 11:49:10.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 11:

Regarding copy_image_to_volume and copy_volume_to_image, I would add your implementation to the base class, and have the LVM implementation override it.'}, {'account_id': 6491, 'date': '2012-12-26 21:42:21.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 11:

Thanks Avishay.  I'll look into this."}, {'account_id': 6491, 'date': '2012-12-27 00:30:51.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 11:

Hi Zhiteng, I looked at how other drivers handle delete_volume when the volume doesn't exist.  In the base class VolumeDriver in Cinder, it returns True if the volume doesn't exist.  Some of the derived Cinder driver classes handle it similarly while others throw an exception.        
                                                            
/cinder/volume/driver.py                                    
class VolumeDriver(object):                                 
    def delete_volume(self, volume):                        
        """Deletes a logical volume."""                     
        if self._volume_not_present(volume['name']):        
            # If the volume isn't present, then don't attempt to delete                                           
            return True                                     
                                                            
I also looked at LibvirtDriver in Nova.  It does not raise exception if the virt_dom is not found.  This might actually be an enhancement from earlier versions.  Now you can actually delete a VM in error status in Horizon.  In earlier Openstack versions (maybe early Essex), a VM with error status can't be deleted and will be shown in Horizon forever (until you manually change the nova db).            
                                                            
nova/virt/libvirt/driver.py                                 
class LibvirtDriver(driver.ComputeDriver):                  
    def _destroy(self, instance):                           
        try:                                                
            virt_dom = self._lookup_by_name(instance['name'])                                                   
        except exception.NotFound:                          
            virt_dom = None                                 
                                                            
So I really believe I handled this properly (log a message but don't raise an exception when the volume doesn't exist during delete_volume).  Thanks.'}, {'account_id': 2243, 'date': '2012-12-27 01:43:10.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 11: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

Hi xing-yang,

Nice work on this.  To clear up the debate on raising versus returning on delete of non-existent volume.  You're approach is CORRECT.  I would prefer NOT to raise in this case and in fact plan to update other drivers to behave the same way.

Until we have better states I prefer NOT raising but logging a n error message and continuing."}, {'account_id': 2243, 'date': '2012-12-27 01:45:17.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 11:

Just to clarify a bit... it's not really an "out of sync" error with the DB.  For example if you have a failed create, when delete is called on that volume it is modified to "deleting" state so there's no indication of whether the create failed, it was in an error state etc.

We should fix this in the future with volume states but for now this should not hold up submission of your driver.'}, {'account_id': 6491, 'date': '2012-12-27 02:40:22.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 11:

Thanks John!'}, {'account_id': 4355, 'date': '2012-12-27 11:31:28.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 11:

John, what do you think about making a generic copy_image_to_volume and copy_volume_to_image?'}, {'account_id': 2759, 'date': '2012-12-28 01:29:43.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 11: Looks good to me (core reviewer); Approved

John, thanks for the clarification.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2012-12-28 01:29:44.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 11: No score

Starting gate jobs.
http://zuul.openstack.org/'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2012-12-28 01:47:36.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 11: Verified

Thanks Zhiteng!  Thanks everyone!'}]

'}, {'created': '2012-12-24 23:17:35.000000000', 'message': 'Add EMC Volume Driver in Cinder

Add support for EMC storage in the Cinder-Volume service.
This driver is based on the existing ISCSIDriver, with the ability to
create/delete and attach/detach volumes and create/delete snapshots, etc.
The Cinder Driver executes the volume operations by communicating with the
backend EMC storage. It uses a CIM client in python called PyWBEM to make
CIM operations over HTTP.
EMC CIM Object Manager (ECOM) is packaged with the SMI-S Provider. It is a
CIM server that allows CIM clients to make CIM operations over HTTP, using
SMI-S in the backend for EMC storage operations.
SMI-S Provider supports the SNIA Storage Management Initiative (SMI), an
ANSI standard for storage management. It supports VMAX/VMAXe and VNX
storage systems.

Implement bp: emc-volume-driver

Change-Id: Iafce98603d31d66a7297ef11c92d5e6ac6ba3737

commit_message:
Add EMC Volume Driver in Cinder

Add support for EMC storage in the Cinder-Volume service.
This driver is based on the existing ISCSIDriver, with the ability to
create/delete and attach/detach volumes and create/delete snapshots, etc.
The Cinder Driver executes the volume operations by communicating with the
backend EMC storage. It uses a CIM client in python called PyWBEM to make
CIM operations over HTTP.
EMC CIM Object Manager (ECOM) is packaged with the SMI-S Provider. It is a
CIM server that allows CIM clients to make CIM operations over HTTP, using
SMI-S in the backend for EMC storage operations.
SMI-S Provider supports the SNIA Storage Management Initiative (SMI), an
ANSI standard for storage management. It supports VMAX/VMAXe and VNX
storage systems.

Implement bp: emc-volume-driver

Change-Id: Iafce98603d31d66a7297ef11c92d5e6ac6ba3737

I understand what you are saying. Using 'updated_at' for querying both created and updated items doesn't matter since every item is to be updated sooner or later and created_at is only for display. Thus you are saying that the 'created_at' and the initial 'updated_at' do not have to be in sync.

But still, you never know what change will happen as the project evolves and you can't expect developers whom will participate in the future to have the same consensus of a condition tied specifically to Quantum .

That is why I insist even though we are inefficient of one more query, we should stick with general design and common sense."}, {'account_id': 1994, 'date': '2012-12-28 00:31:42.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: (1 inline comment)

2. I know the time difference between created_at and initial updated_at even we are in light load env. but since we don't use created_at in code to query resources, it does not matter.

commit_message:
Add created_at and updated_at datetime columns.

blueprint rpc-for-l3-agent

This is first task for the BP.

Add these two columns into quantumbase object so that all of quantum
DB model objects will have them. Add unit tests to make sure they work
as we wish.

Updated_at will be set once object is created, which is useful and
convinient for us to query changed objects (including newly created ones)

Also suggest the list_xxx show objects with updated_at desc order.

Change-Id: I89d0a7c36a5b7e182e84bb1df73b4ecb6f51a7a0

DescribeStackResources failed when called with a physical resource ID
instead of a stack name. Also add a unit test to alert us to any future
breakage.

Signed-off-by: Zane Bitter <zbitter@redhat.com>

revisions:
[{'created': '2012-12-21 18:05:27.000000000', 'message': 'Handle duplicate physical resources IDs

Because the unit tests create multiple stacks in different tenants with the
same physical resource ID, the database lookup code must change to
accomodate this.

This enables us to add a unit test for the describe_stack_resources RPC
API call for the case where we pass a physical resource ID to lookup.

Change-Id: Id37b15bee595ba10f207235a3ff59526e4423be6
Signed-off-by: Zane Bitter <zbitter@redhat.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Handle duplicate physical resources IDs

Because the unit tests create multiple stacks in different tenants with the
same physical resource ID, the database lookup code must change to
accomodate this.

This enables us to add a unit test for the describe_stack_resources RPC
API call for the case where we pass a physical resource ID to lookup.

Change-Id: Id37b15bee595ba10f207235a3ff59526e4423be6
Signed-off-by: Zane Bitter <zbitter@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Add generic account rc creater

* Creates account rc files for all tenant user
* Able to create new accounts
* The rc files contains certificates for image bundle
* euca related steps can be simpler in the future

Change-Id: I917bffb64e09a5d85c84cde45777c49eaca65e64

commit_message:
clean up cinder on an unstack

cinder currently has issues that leave volumes around
after tempest tests. Make sure that cinder gets cleaned
up to a zero state on an unstack.sh so that we can reset
the environment.

Change-Id: I448340899bf0fae7d4d16fa26da17feafcef888f

commit_message:
Make opensuse-12.2 a supported distribution

This has been working well in my tests, and has been confirmed to work
by others.

I'll of course step up to fix things for openSUSE when needed.

Change-Id: I1ecd345adf975b082aff3a473ab94291b39c8c93

subject: Refactor quantum installation
messages:
[{'account_id': 3, 'date': '2012-12-21 07:09:50.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Works for me

Build successful

- http://logs.openstack.org/18530/1/check/gate-tempest-devstack-vm/23337 : SUCCESS
'}, {'account_id': 2750, 'date': '2012-12-21 14:06:45.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

(5 inline comments)

First, thank you very much for doing this!

A couple of inline items to check out. Some errant hard tabs snuck in.

Also, in stack.sh and unstack.sh we always want the library calls behind a service conditional. So I think you just need to pull up some of the conditionals out of lib/quantum to stack.sh.

This is quite good otherwise. I'm going to be off for the next few days for the holidays, but I'll keep an eye on this patch to try to help it through."}, {'account_id': 841, 'date': '2012-12-21 17:45:20.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 841, 'date': '2012-12-21 18:09:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: (3 inline comments)

'}, {'account_id': 970, 'date': '2012-12-21 18:11:40.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

(2 inline comments)

This is great, thanks for tackling it.  I've got a couple of minor comments and a request.  I like to have functions sorted alphabetically, although given the number in lib/quantum maybe sorting them within the sections makes more sense?"}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2012-12-21 18:25:21.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Works for me

Build successful

- http://logs.openstack.org/18530/2/check/gate-tempest-devstack-vm/23383 : SUCCESS
'}, {'account_id': 841, 'date': '2012-12-26 02:55:36.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: (2 inline comments)

Thanks for your detail review!

I agree it is reasonable to sort function with alphabetical order. Since lib/quantum has many function, I sort functions per categories (entry points, internal functions, quantum exercises, 3rd party programs). Note that functions in 3rd party program category are sorted per 3rd party program. In addition, internal function names in lib/quantum start with an underscore.

(question) In other lib/* "python setup.py develop" is called within configure_*. IMO,  "python setup.py develop" is a part of install_* rather than configure_*. Is there any reason setup.py is a part of configure_*? According to my test, there seems to be no problem even if setup_develop is moved from configure_* to install_*. (During the I found python-openstackclinet requires keystoneclient <0.2 and it conflicts with other OpenStack projects)'}, {'account_id': 841, 'date': '2012-12-26 02:56:15.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2012-12-26 03:12:18.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Works for me

Build successful

- http://logs.openstack.org/18530/3/check/gate-tempest-devstack-vm/23566 : SUCCESS
'}, {'account_id': 1653, 'date': '2012-12-26 07:50:07.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: (6 inline comments)

Hi,
Looks great. Some minor inline comments.
My only concern is the keystone file change. I think that this is a file from keystone. Not 100% sure about that. 
Thanks
Gary'}, {'account_id': 333, 'date': '2012-12-26 10:15:14.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: (2 inline comments)

Thank you for addressing before me. It looks great.

I think some code can be simplified/generalized with parameter expansion. But such cleanup should be another patch.
I'll address it after merging this patch unless you do before me."}, {'account_id': 841, 'date': '2012-12-26 14:41:10.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: (6 inline comments)

'}, {'account_id': 841, 'date': '2012-12-26 14:41:50.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2012-12-26 14:57:54.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Works for me

Build successful

- http://logs.openstack.org/18530/4/check/gate-tempest-devstack-vm/23573 : SUCCESS
'}, {'account_id': 841, 'date': '2012-12-26 17:50:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

Thanks everyone for the reviews.

Now I use "third party" programs to refer to network controllers which are not a part of the OpenStack project. However they are partner or cooperative programs rather than third party programs. I am wondering a better word.
If you have more appropriate word, please let me know.'}, {'account_id': 333, 'date': '2012-12-27 04:03:02.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

Looks good.
As for the naming, I don't have strong preference and don't think of better name."}, {'account_id': 1653, 'date': '2012-12-27 12:33:11.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: (1 inline comment)

'}, {'account_id': 1653, 'date': '2012-12-27 12:36:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: (1 inline comment)

One minor little nit.
Thanks for the updates'}, {'account_id': 1653, 'date': '2012-12-27 12:41:57.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

Hi,
I have tested with ovs plugin and it works well.
Thanks
Gary'}, {'account_id': 970, 'date': '2012-12-27 21:07:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Looks good to me (core reviewer); Approved

'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2012-12-27 21:07:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: No score

Starting gate jobs.
http://zuul.openstack.org/'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2012-12-27 21:47:49.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Verified

Build successful

- http://logs.openstack.org/18530/4/gate/gate-tempest-devstack-vm/23620 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/18530/4/gate/gate-tempest-devstack-vm-quantum/403 : FAILURE (non-voting)
- http://logs.openstack.org/18530/4/gate/gate-devstack-vm-quantum/57 : SUCCESS (non-voting)

revisions:
[{'created': '2012-12-21 06:45:02.000000000', 'message': "Refactor quantum installation

* Move quantum installation to lib/quantum
* Refactor quantum configuration
* Move Quantum service account creation from keystone_data.sh to lib/quantum
* Define generic functions to install third party programs

* Minor cleanups related to Quantum
  * Kill dnsmasq which watches an interface 'ns-XXXXXX' in unstack.sh
  * Set default_floating_pool in nova.conf to make default flaoting pool
    work when PUBLIC_NETWORK_NAME is other than 'nova'
  * Make tempest work even when PRIVATE_NETWORK_NAME is other than 'private'

Change-Id: I4a6e7fcebfb11556968f53ab6a0e862ce16bb139
"}, {'created': '2012-12-21 17:45:20.000000000', 'message': "Refactor quantum installation

* Move quantum installation to lib/quantum
* Refactor quantum configuration
* Move Quantum service account creation from keystone_data.sh to lib/quantum
* Define generic functions to install third party programs

commit_message:
Refactor quantum installation

* Move quantum installation to lib/quantum
* Refactor quantum configuration
* Move Quantum service account creation from keystone_data.sh to lib/quantum
* Define generic functions to install third party programs

* Minor cleanups related to Quantum
  * Kill dnsmasq which watches an interface 'ns-XXXXXX' in unstack.sh
  * Set default_floating_pool in nova.conf to make default flaoting pool
    work when PUBLIC_NETWORK_NAME is other than 'nova'
  * Make tempest work even when PRIVATE_NETWORK_NAME is other than 'private'

Change-Id: I4a6e7fcebfb11556968f53ab6a0e862ce16bb139

Constrain eventlet version.

in unit tests after the release of eventlet 0.10.0 to Pipy.

commit_message:
Support latest eventlet changes

Specifically the change from this bug report
https://bitbucket.org/which_linden/eventlet/issue/92/eventletgreen-override-of-oswaitpid

breaks the nova and oslo builds. To avoid looping inside
eventlet's patch to waitpid, we need to pass in WNOHANG
and use waitpid instead of wait

Fixes LP #1094076

Change-Id: I26c51e7b602b92d4a0043a41fd9871eb9139f8bf

commit_message:
Increment minimum required keystoneclient version number

The movement of auth_token from keystone to keystoneclient is part
of the updated 0.2 version of keystoneclient.  The server still
maintains an import back from the client for backward compatibility.
However, in order to support this, installations must upgrade to
the latest 0.2 version of the client.

Change-Id: I1ed1ebebbd56b2ed9c035c9e7d83783c8b2ae5fc

commit_message:
Fix MySQL charset error.

If using MySQL, there's a bug with the charset setting which is declared as
a variable whereas it should be a string. This fixes bug #1092856 and adds
a test for this.

Change-Id: I76e19e2dd86f920aa7c9f792da7057d42ed3e9c9

a variable whereas it should be a string. This fixes bug #1092856 and adds
a test for this.

Signed-off-by: Julien Danjou <julien@danjou.info>

commit_message:
Fix MySQL model charset

If using MySQL, there's a bug with the charset setting which is declared as
a variable whereas it should be a string. This fixes bug #1092856 and adds
a test for this.

Change-Id: Ib5d1dd3cc16c669f1e0445896453dbe8bf181ab8
Signed-off-by: Julien Danjou <julien@danjou.info>

commit_message:
Ensure we add a new line when appending to rc.local

When we add content to rc.local, if the file already
exists then we need to make sure we add the content
after a new line explicitly

Fixes LP #1089668

Change-Id: I35be1496703b302f732363fa76ce832505eed599

(same comment from last patch rev)"}, {'account_id': 2835, 'date': '2012-11-16 22:45:20.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

Johannes - Changed the opts to ListOpt, good idea.

Vek - Cleaned up the option registration a bit.  It should be less verbose now in nova/hooks.py if that list of hooks grows now.

It could still get wordy defining many option values in your nova.conf, but at least it's simple.  I'd rather not make the actual option value specification more complex (and error-prone) unless it's clearly needed.

Thanks as always for feedback!"}, {'account_id': 2835, 'date': '2012-11-16 22:47:55.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

Interesting idea Russell, let me play around with that one.'}, {'account_id': 1561, 'date': '2012-11-16 22:49:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

Cool, sounds good.

Also, check with comstud ... I seem to remember him working on some sort of generic plugin loading code earlier this week.  It may or may not help here.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2012-11-16 23:03:38.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Works for me

'}, {'account_id': 1030, 'date': '2012-11-17 01:56:23.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

(1 inline comment)

Cool... we need hooks!   The thing I was working on earlier in the week was nova/loadables.py which has merged.  It was just moving the scheduler filter __init__ code there... and it's something completely separate from hooks.  But we do need hooks for various reasons.  Breaking some things out in compute/api and allowing them to be hooked would mostly allow ditching of the special cells compute api class."}, {'account_id': 2835, 'date': '2012-11-19 18:24:50.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 2835, 'date': '2012-11-19 18:27:29.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

Added a loading mechanism based on the nova/loadables.py.  There is now a single config param that takes a list of loader classes.  Loaders find hook classes.  Each hook class has a 'name' attribute that matches the name of the hook added via the decorator."}, {'account_id': 1561, 'date': '2012-11-19 18:32:17.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

Why isn't there an implementation of a loader?  Also, why does the loader need to be a configuration option?  Can we just have a single built-in loader that loads modules, and on load, the modules register their hooks?"}, {'account_id': 679, 'date': '2012-11-19 18:35:10.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: (1 inline comment)

'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2012-11-19 18:48:09.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Works for me

'}, {'account_id': 2835, 'date': '2012-11-19 21:17:15.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4: (1 inline comment)

Vek - I did think a little bit about letting the handlers modify arguments and/or return values.  I think it would potentially be useful, but then there should be an order of invocation type semantic on the hook classes and I didn't want to introduce the additional complexity initially.

Russell - I'm going to add a default loader and allow the hooks to register themselves.
 
I do like the concept of being able to specify multiple loaders, though, as a way to indicate when you want to pull in hooks that aren't part of the nova codebase.  I'm not sure how you could indicate where such hooks live otherwise?"}, {'account_id': 2835, 'date': '2012-11-19 21:17:50.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

Hmm, insane formatting.  Sorry about that. :)'}, {'account_id': 2835, 'date': '2012-11-19 21:27:28.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 679, 'date': '2012-11-19 21:35:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

'}, {'account_id': 1561, 'date': '2012-11-19 21:47:34.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

(1 inline comment)

I still don't think the configuration option should be there.  I get the need to have loaders of more than one type, but we can still do that without having it exposed to the configuration file.  I really don't like unnecessarily exposing this implementation detail to the config.

You mention the use case of hooks that aren't part of the codebase.  There are no uses of this in the code base, or as a part of a patch that depends on this one, so I assume that's the *primary* use case.  I don't think this should go in until there is a good *built-in* way for supporting hooks from modules that are not a part of the code-base.

It could be a built-in loader with a configurable module path that defaults to something like /usr/lib/nova/modules/ (someone more into the standard use of different paths should comment on the choice of path).  That path could be configurable, though."}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2012-11-19 21:50:06.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5: Doesn't seem to work

Kevin, I like the idea of an exception handler, but agree that it should be future work. :)'}, {'account_id': 1030, 'date': '2012-11-30 08:05:21.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 8: (1 inline comment)

This is cool.  I don't know anything about entrypoints.  Does this mean we can only define hook callbacks within separate packages?  Ie, we'd not be able to use them internally within nova without some sort of (unknown to me) additional code?"}, {'account_id': 2835, 'date': '2012-11-30 15:41:31.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 8:

Chris - the entry_points are defined in setup.py files.  When you install a package, an entry_points.txt file gets created.  These are most typically used for console scripts, (see novaclient or supernova) but can be used as an arbitrary plugin/resource loading mechanism.

You could add hook objects by adding items to entry_points in nova's setup.py, but the nice part of doing it via a separate package is you don't have to change anything within the Nova codebase."}, {'account_id': 100, 'date': '2012-11-30 16:05:17.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8: (1 inline comment)

'}, {'account_id': 1561, 'date': '2012-11-30 16:05:22.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8:

It would be nice to have some docs on how to write hooks inside or outside of nova, perhaps in a big docstring somewhere.  (Not a -1 issue, just something that would be nice)'}, {'account_id': 679, 'date': '2012-11-30 16:18:34.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8: (1 inline comment)

* removed hook base class.  No point in forcing an explicit dependency on Nova in an external package providing hook object. (duck-typing is better)

* good comments on exception handling and modification of return value.  I'd prefer to keep things simple now and iterate later, but will get them in if folks would prefer to have them now."}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2012-11-30 20:17:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9: Works for me

'}, {'account_id': 642, 'date': '2012-12-04 16:03:28.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 10: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

We desperately need a "I like the patch, but I want to understand something better" radio button.

It's kind of funny how we're slowly adding Rails to Nova one patch at a time :-D

Snark aside, I like the patch. However, this feels more like something you implement as an external module and petition to get added to Nova. The actual code itself has nothing to do with any functionality in Nova, but is very useful for cleaning up the project. I would actually suggest we remove the implementation and include it as an external dependency.'}, {'account_id': 2835, 'date': '2012-12-05 01:28:06.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 10:

Matt - I get what you're saying, but not sure it's worth creating an external lib for what's basically a 1 file wrapper of stevedore and entry_points?"}, {'account_id': 1561, 'date': '2012-12-05 13:06:43.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 10: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

nice work. I wonder why the two hooks added are "create" from API and "delete" from manager. Any particular reasons or just for demonstration? Thanks.'}, {'account_id': 2835, 'date': '2012-12-10 17:26:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 10:

Yun, I put the delete hook on the manager side because in the soft delete case the actual deleted is queued and happens later on.'}, {'account_id': 642, 'date': '2012-12-10 18:18:19.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 10: Looks good to me (core reviewer); Approved

'}, {'created': '2012-11-29 15:39:18.000000000', 'message': "Add generic customization hooks via decorator.

Hooks add the ability to insert custom code around operations that
declare a named hook:

e.g.

@hooks.add_hooks('create_instance')
def create_instance(....):
   ....

The above hook allows Hook objects to be run 'pre' and 'post' the
execution of create_instance()

Hook objects are discovered via the setuptools entry point group
'nova.hooks'.

Change-Id: I3961df12ef415085de7459438967edacc34500c2
"}, {'created': '2012-11-29 16:06:46.000000000', 'message': "Add generic customization hooks via decorator.

commit_message:
Add generic customization hooks via decorator.

Hooks add the ability to insert custom code around operations that
declare a named hook:

e.g.

@hooks.add_hooks('create_instance')
def create_instance(....):
   ....

The above hook allows Hook objects to be run 'pre' and 'post' the
execution of create_instance()

Hook objects are discovered via the setuptools entry point group
'nova.hooks'.

Change-Id: I3961df12ef415085de7459438967edacc34500c2

[{'created': '2012-12-10 13:11:12.000000000', 'message': 'Implements database upgrade as storage engine independent

Currently, calling ceilometer-dbsync will be default raises an error since
it tries to upgrade a SQL database, even if mongo (the default) is used.
This patch fixes that by adding an upgrade capability to the storage engine
connection base class, and implementing it only in SQL.

Change-Id: I9a0da235ef3a93aaefd1b122d59f244ea293e9fe
Signed-off-by: Julien Danjou <julien@danjou.info>
'}]
commit_message:
Implements database upgrade as storage engine independent

Currently, calling ceilometer-dbsync will be default raises an error since
it tries to upgrade a SQL database, even if mongo (the default) is used.
This patch fixes that by adding an upgrade capability to the storage engine
connection base class, and implementing it only in SQL.

Change-Id: I9a0da235ef3a93aaefd1b122d59f244ea293e9fe
Signed-off-by: Julien Danjou <julien@danjou.info>

Just on a general point about how this code is structured ... are we guaranteed that nova notifiers are run synchronously?

If not, e.g. if the notifier chain was run via a thread pool, then we'd have a race condition whereby we may attempt to poll the instance after its been deleted.

Just a thought, not really directly related to the change proposed in this patch.

Cheers,
Eoghan"}, {'account_id': 4573, 'date': '2012-12-10 08:48:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

I think this is ok, at least in current nova implementation.

This code is executed in nova as a notification driver. According to the implementation in nova notification driver, this is sync implementation. The nova will continue only after this notify code continued.

In fact, this raise a issue to nova,that 3rd party notification driver is in fact out of control of nova.'}, {'account_id': 1669, 'date': '2012-12-10 09:59:11.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

[{'created': '2012-12-25 23:40:31.000000000', 'message': 'Provide "atomic" database access for networks

Fixes bug 1093637

In the OVS and LB plugins there are cases when accessing the network
has an additional database query. The patch enables this to occur
without accessing an invalid database entry.

Change-Id: I7d4944cf3240819f23dd7b4993d6ae3cefab9dc2
'}]
commit_message:
Provide "atomic" database access for networks

Fixes bug 1093637

In the OVS and LB plugins there are cases when accessing the network
has an additional database query. The patch enables this to occur
without accessing an invalid database entry.

Change-Id: I7d4944cf3240819f23dd7b4993d6ae3cefab9dc2

[{'created': '2012-12-18 13:32:33.000000000', 'message': 'Avoid mnt namespace pollution for lxc

Unlike other hypervisor to directly using image for VM, rootfs need to
be mounted in setup_container() for lxc before launching the domain.

However, this leads to several problems:

* previously spawned container polluted later spawned container, which
  in turn causing lvm device refused to be removed, as bug descirbes
* container rootfs not mounted after nova stop/start sequence

This commit addressed above two issues.

Fixes bug 1091639

Change-Id: I718baa6e46cf07a5458a5b80d42139dd353ae51c

commit_message:
Teardown container rootfs in host namespace for lxc

Unlike other hypervisor to directly using image for VM, rootfs need to
be mounted in setup_container() for lxc before launching the domain.

However, this leads to several problems:

* previously spawned container polluted later spawned container, which
  in turn causing lvm device refused to be removed, as bug descirbes
* container rootfs not mounted after nova stop/start sequence

This commit addresses above two issues.

Fixes bug 1091639

Change-Id: I718baa6e46cf07a5458a5b80d42139dd353ae51c

commit_message:
Add send_arp_for_ha option to multihost-HA doc

fixes bug 1093000

The bug report explains well the issues that can be encountered
when using multihost HA flatDHCP, where ARP caches are not up to
 date. This patch adds the config option as a recommendation and
explains its purpose.

Change-Id: I0ca1e218c219f15f86f196531bb8a5fc342383dc

commit_message:
Revert "Use requests module for HTTP/HTTPS"

This reverts commit 51dc6a0cef657cf9fa110da11d81d1c3f13194fa which introduces a new dependency ('requests') for keystoneclient, which keystone does not install while running unit tests against the client.

commit_message:
Use requests module for HTTP/HTTPS

* Implement correct certificate verification
* Add requests to tools/pip-requires
* Fix OS_CACERT env var help text
* Add info to README
* Rework tests to use requests

Pinned requests module to < 1.0 as 1.0.2 is now current in pipi
as of 17Dec2012.

Change-Id: I120d2c12d6f20ebe2fd7182ec8988cc73f623b80

[{'created': '2012-12-24 04:25:04.000000000', 'message': 'Ensure datetimes can be properly serialized.

The nova-network manager was returning db models from methods invoked
via rpc.call(). These db models include non-primitive types that can
not be properly serialized (namely datetime objects). Use
to_primitive() to ensure that the data gets serialized properly.

Fix bug: #1089430

Change-Id: I28337c8c5f03a9c35330502a1edbd47288fd27f8
Signed-off-by: zhiyanliu <lzy.dev@gmail.com>'}]
commit_message:
Ensure datetimes can be properly serialized.

The nova-network manager was returning db models from methods invoked
via rpc.call(). These db models include non-primitive types that can
not be properly serialized (namely datetime objects). Use
to_primitive() to ensure that the data gets serialized properly.

Fix bug: #1089430

Change-Id: I28337c8c5f03a9c35330502a1edbd47288fd27f8
Signed-off-by: zhiyanliu <lzy.dev@gmail.com>

@John, your underlying patch won't be allowed to merge without PEP8 fixes, so you either need to (for example) 'git commit --amend' that patch, or 'git rebase -i HEAD~2' and squash your commits together, etc."}, {'account_id': 6493, 'date': '2012-12-19 23:03:22.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 4, 'date': '2012-12-19 23:16:48.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Do not merge

git commit --amend again and revise your commit message, maintaining only your original Change-Id as the last line of the commit (Change-Id: I5bd0ad2e21055b3e6f8153a844f4269f358e54d6), then abandon this review in favor of the origin review.

No need to note your pep8 fixes in the final commit message either, as that won't make sense outside of gerrit."}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2012-12-19 23:21:46.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Works for me

commit_message:
Adding a means to connect back to a pydevd debugger.

That patch allows a developer to remotely run a pydev debugger and have the
keystone-all process connect back to it.  Two command line options are
introduced:
    --pydev-debug-host <host>
    --pydev-debug-port <port>
both of the above options are required to enable this behavior.

This patch only enables this behavior when the service is started with
keystone-all.  In the future parts of this patch can be used to enable
this behavior when running in Apache.

Change-Id: I92f99fa34112336a96e42e8261b7313f23ee994e

commit_message:
Add "baremetal_" prefix to bm config options.

Two baremetal options were missing the "baremetal_" prefix.
power_manager -> baremetal_power_manager
instance_type_extra_specs -> baremetal_instance_type_extra_specs

blueprint general-bare-metal-provisioning-framework.

Change-Id: I9b24bf15d978973fc7f826fa90fecd0e0ff72f4d

(1 inline comment)

"}, {'account_id': 2035, 'date': '2012-12-20 23:06:06.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: (1 inline comment)

Matthew: I've replied inline."}, {'account_id': 5196, 'date': '2012-12-21 02:52:22.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

(1 inline comment)

'}, {'account_id': 5174, 'date': '2012-12-21 12:23:15.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

'}, {'account_id': 5803, 'date': '2012-12-21 17:40:41.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: (1 inline comment)

The resources for automatic delete can be added by the set_resource, and can be removed from the automatic delete queue by remove_resource.

If we ignore not found situations, we would not see if the resource removed by accident or a really failed delete by some mystic reason reposes with 404.

Why we can't use the remove_resource always when the resource delete expected ?"}, {'account_id': 2035, 'date': '2012-12-21 17:54:54.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

afazekas: Why would it be important to know if a resource had been deleted for some reason (accidental or otherwise) before test cleanup was reached?  The intent of cleanup is to ensure that resources are removed safely.  So long as that goal is met, the method is unimportant.'}, {'account_id': 5803, 'date': '2012-12-22 00:34:48.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Maru Newby: We might not catch a bug, if do not disturbing the unintended delete (by some not requested reason the recurse became "invisible") from the planned ones.

I agree the tearDown should do everything for proper cleanup.
The teardown also should show not intended behavior, and should not hide a possible bug.

https://github.com/openstack/tempest/blob/master/tempest/testboto.py#L184
The linked approach also "not standard" and not recommended in any other case.
It attempts to clean up all resources, but logs the issues, and reports the teardown operation as an ERROR. (Reporting FAIL is correct too)

Do you think we need to follow a different path with smoke.py ?'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2012-12-22 20:45:55.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: No score

Starting gate jobs.
http://zuul.openstack.org/'}, {'account_id': 7, 'date': '2012-12-22 20:45:55.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Looks good to me (core reviewer); Approved

(1 inline comment)

'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2012-12-22 22:07:06.000000000', 'content': 'Change has been successfully merged into the git repository.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2012-12-22 22:07:06.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Verified

Build successful

- http://logs.openstack.org/18505/2/gate/gate-tempest-devstack-vm/23453 : SUCCESS
'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2012-12-20 20:01:26.000000000', 'message': 'Add error handling to smoke test cleanup.

 * DefaultClientSmokeTest.tearDownClass was previously calling
   delete() on test resources without error handling.  Since the
   intent of the method is to remove test resources, a NotFound
   exception can safely be ignored if the resource has already
   been removed.

Change-Id: Idd289d2f3ce4133c49b0c882304d6ad6695a7396
'}, {'created': '2012-12-20 20:02:10.000000000', 'message': 'Add error handling to smoke test cleanup.

 * DefaultClientSmokeTest.tearDownClass was previously calling
   delete() on test resources without error handling.  Since the
   intent of the method is to remove test resources, a NotFound
   exception indicating that the resource has already been
   removed can safely be ignored.

Change-Id: Idd289d2f3ce4133c49b0c882304d6ad6695a7396
'}]
commit_message:
Add error handling to smoke test cleanup.

 * DefaultClientSmokeTest.tearDownClass was previously calling
   delete() on test resources without error handling.  Since the
   intent of the method is to remove test resources, a NotFound
   exception indicating that the resource has already been
   removed can safely be ignored.

Change-Id: Idd289d2f3ce4133c49b0c882304d6ad6695a7396

subject: Do not limit the max versions in the requirements
messages:
[{'account_id': 3, 'date': '2012-12-19 19:40:15.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Works for me

Build successful

- http://logs.openstack.org/18406/1/check/gate-tempest-pep8/1274 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/18406/1/check/gate-tempest-devstack-vm/23045 : SUCCESS
'}, {'account_id': 5196, 'date': '2012-12-20 20:16:43.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

I'm pretty sure that the client major version numbers are pinned to the api version. So this just means that we aren't going accidentally use a client for a new api version before we have support for the new api version.

If we didn't have this upper bound here when a new client got pushed out for a new api version it could possibly break the tempest gate if the new api version breaks compatibility. This is just a safety net for when api versions get updated.

I also just copy and pasted these pip requirements from the other projects' pip-requires files. I'll change this to a +1 if it turns out that I'm incorrect about the client version numbers though."}, {'account_id': 5803, 'date': '2012-12-21 09:12:35.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

The pip only updates the versions if it necessary.

It we limit the version, and other package requires newer version, the current tempest devstack install accidentally could break other packages, by downgrading the clients.

When we create stable tempest branches, sounds reasonable to limit the version. But with the master we should be compatible with other master branches.

The client's usually able to support multiple api version:
https://github.com/openstack/python-glanceclient/blob/master/glanceclient/shell.py#L235
https://github.com/openstack/python-keystoneclient/blob/master/keystoneclient/shell.py#L127
https://github.com/openstack/python-novaclient/blob/master/novaclient/shell.py#L190
They have api version named directories too.

The tempest config file contains API versions, so possible to have the clients to speak the right versions."}, {'account_id': 5196, 'date': '2012-12-21 15:12:47.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

Ok, I didn't realize that we specified the API version in the config file. That gets around the concern I had when migrating between api versions.

I definitely agree that whenever we start doing stable branches of tempest that we should set an upper bound on the client version."}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2012-12-22 20:37:58.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: No score

Starting gate jobs.
http://zuul.openstack.org/'}, {'account_id': 7, 'date': '2012-12-22 20:37:58.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Looks good to me (core reviewer); Approved

lgtm, thx Attila.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2012-12-22 21:44:38.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Verified

Build successful

- http://logs.openstack.org/18406/1/gate/gate-tempest-pep8/1295 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/18406/1/gate/gate-tempest-devstack-vm/23451 : SUCCESS
'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2012-12-22 21:44:38.000000000', 'content': 'Change has been successfully merged into the git repository.'}]

commit_message:
allow for the ability to run partial coverage

the way the coverage exclusion was made previously meant that
if you ran coverage, it would always run all the tests. Fix
this so you can run a subset.

Change-Id: I057587204728d379e2a43b5c5ee14fe91f83f64b

commit_message:
Reliably include OS type in ephemeral filenames.

Either include the OS type, or "default" if this isn't specified.

Also, I don't see why we care what ephemeral disk number this disk
was created as (they're all empty images in base, right?) so I've
removed that.

Resolves bug 1087030.

Change-Id: Iee7f8e9033a2e6a829421763090ed0e67c6b2da8

'}, {'account_id': 1779, 'date': '2012-12-18 10:18:41.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

According to the bug, the main motivating factor here is actually to improve performance, rather than reduce disk usage - it'd be good to mention that in the commit message.

It would be slightly more disk-space efficient if you'd actually kept the 2 files in _base, but made the 2nd one a qcow2 image, since then the resized filesystem metadata wouldn't be duplicated for each instance. That's so minor though, I'm fine with the way you did it.

+1'ing, but if you have to respin for any reason, be nice to update the commit message to mention the performance improvement."}, {'account_id': 2750, 'date': '2012-12-21 13:46:36.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

commit_message:
libvirt: Skip intermediate base files with qcow2.

Instead of having two files in _base (the original and a resized
copy), let's just keep the originals and resize with the qcow2
image in the instance's directory. This will reduce the size of
_base and simplify cleanup. This also simplifies resizing of
instance disk images later.

Resolves bug 1087031.

Change-Id: Id91426e3cb9f75f31339b5156785e3782a4cb98f

Small re-factoring of the xvp console mainly checking
to make sure that we catch exceptions when they haappen.

is there a corresponding identity api review that this is implementing?'}, {'account_id': 4992, 'date': '2012-12-12 07:27:36.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Should not groups.py create and update methods allow for specifying something more than just name and description, something along the lines of a list of one or more items, where each item is a privilege.

And the group manager support the above. 

In roles.py, naming the methods _require_domain_xor_project
and _require_user_xor_group  (that is xor versus or) would make their semantics more obvious.

A user could belong to more than one group, (and guessing a domain can contain more than one project), so the order of checks.

May be I am missing something but the list method may be clearer written as:
def list(self, user=None, group=None, domain=None, project=None):
 """
if (user or group):
    self._reguire .. (domain, project)
    self.require .. (user, group)
    return super(RoleManager, self).list(       base_url=self._role_grants_base_url(user,group,domain,project))
return super(RoleManager, self).list()'}, {'account_id': 5707, 'date': '2012-12-12 09:02:16.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 5707, 'date': '2012-12-12 09:09:03.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

malini-k-bhandaru:  Good comments - I have modified the code to match - except for your first one.  The Groups object itself doesn't have additional  attributes for things like role permissions etc.....those are handled by adding/removing users to a group (via the UserManager) as well as role assignment in similar way as it is done for users (in the RoleManager).  Could you expand on your comment?

Dolph:  The api spec is linked to the blueprint, but is repeated here: https://docs.google.com/document/d/1Ce6iVPl38_7fNHENNtfCXIrXVQIFqOZZgX0zNIzFLSo/edit"}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2012-12-12 09:31:59.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Works for me

'}, {'account_id': 5707, 'date': '2012-12-19 09:37:31.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 6:

Hi Guang - sorry, looks like my reply to your earlier comment wasn't published!  I'm not sure where you are seeing 
PUT /domains/domainID/roles/roleID ?

However, I think you are referring to the base_url that gets built in _role_grants_base_url()?  If so, then it is important to remember that the existing design of all of the v3 EntityManagers is that any key or collection_key is added by the super class (i.e. base.CrudManager).  So in the case of, for example:

base_url = /domains/domainID/group/groupID

then the CrudManager will append the 'roles/roleID' component to the end of this.  You can see that this is tested, for the above example, in test_roles.py in test_domain_group_role_grant().

Does this answer your question, or am I missing the point?"}, {'account_id': 5707, 'date': '2012-12-19 09:38:30.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: (1 inline comment)

commit_message:
Add support for user groups

This initial change provides the support in keystoneclient to match the api
specified in the blueprint.  Keystone itself does not yet support these
calls, so if you actually called these, then you would get an error from
the server. However the changes should be benign in terms of other api calls.

Blueprint keystone/+spec/user-groups
Api changes: review.openstack.org/#/c/18138

DocImpact

Change-Id: I9abfa82b39fa0c6d58fe0d22622944d3e6be39be

You could also add a register(name, instance) method or something to register any object you'd like."}, {'account_id': 2218, 'date': '2012-12-20 01:40:18.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

'}, {'account_id': 2218, 'date': '2012-12-21 17:05:07.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

I think there is a problem with this approach.  I am having trouble getting the dependencies to resolve using it for a test.  The registration of a class to fill a dependency has to preceed the construction of the class.  Otherwise, classes will not be instantiated on demand.

Thus @dependency.provider needs to put the entry into REGISTRY = {}  when it is processed, not when the constructor is called.  This needs to register a callback function to construct the class on demand.

I think."}, {'account_id': 4, 'date': '2012-12-21 17:26:31.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

ayoung: where would the __init__() configuration of the provider objects come from? all of our providers happen to pull from CONF, but that's not much of a general use case"}, {'account_id': 2218, 'date': '2012-12-21 17:27:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

commit_message:
Driver registry

Uses automatic dependency injection to provide controllers with driver
interfaces (identity_api, token_api, etc).

See tests/test_injection.py for a self-contained example.

Change-Id: I255087de534292fbf57a45b19f97488f831f607c

commit_message:
Make the NetAppISCSIDriver._is_clone_done() method able to handle
empty responses. Add unit tests to exercise this case.

bug 1090168
